Cat & Chocolate: Business Is Business can be played as a standalone game or combined with Cat & Chocolate. Instead of the original game's haunted mansion theme, Business Is Business revolves around wacky situations that arise from a life in the corporate world.

Each turn, the player draws an event and tells the story of how she would avoid disaster with up to 1-3 item cards in her hand. Whether it's "stomachache in the middle of a presentation" or "your boss's wig is off-center", what will you do when you have only sushi or a self-enrichment book? It's a test of the player's imagination and life experience!

Should your story be accepted by at least half of the other players, you get to keep the event card and play continues until a special event card called "End!" is revealed. Whoever has scored the most event cards wins.
151215.name: Cat & Chocolate: Business Is Business

151216.name: Nautilus (Issue 21 - Dec/Feb 2003/2004)
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
151216.description:
Tie-in to the theatrical movie The Return of the King, this issue features mainly content for Middle-Earth and puts a focus on the rings of power. It includes introductory rules and adventure for the Lord of the Rings RPG (24-page inlay with separate pagination), and a generic scenario (Ein Traum von Macht by Falk Behr) set in and around a laketown, which can be used in a Middle-Earth game, but might also be transported into DSA or other fantasy games. There's also a sneak peek at content from Fell Beasts and Wondrous Magic (= Wilde Bestien und wundersame Magie).

Beyond the LOTR focus, the issue provides some information and interviews about D&D, Exalted, WoD, DSA, Cthulhu, and several board and video games and movies

151217.name: Roolipelaaminen - Eläytymistä ja fantasiaharrastusverkostoja
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
151217.description:
Title in english: Roleplaying - Empathy and fantasy hobby networks.

Translated from back of the book:
What are roleplaying games and where are they played? Are history recreation and LARPing the same thing? Can roleplaying be dangerous?

Even though roleplaying games have been played in Finland for about thirty years, the hobby still raises questions and is relatively unknown to many. Roolipelaaminen - Eläytymistä ja fantasiaharrastusverkostoja offers a compact infopackage about the polymorphic world of roleplaying games. Roleplaying is part of a wider network of hobbies, which includes many different kinds of action from miniature gaming to anime-fandom. Common hobbies form networks between players as well.

This book open the roleplaying hobby for people not knowing it before and working with children and teenagers and to others interested.

The actual text in finnish:
Mitä roolipelit ovat ja missä niitä pelataan? Tarkoittavatko keskiaikaharrastus ja larppaaminen samaa asiaa? Voiko roolipelaaminen olla vaarallista?

Vaikka roolipelejä on Suomessakin pelattu jo kolmisenkymmentä vuotta, harrastus herättää edelleen kysymyksiä ja on monille melko tuntematon. Roolipelaaminen - Eläytymistä ja fantasiaharrastusverkostoja tarjoaa tiiviin tietopaketin roolipelien monimuotoisesta maailmasta. Roolipelit ovat osa laajaa hararstusten verkostoa, johon voi kuulua monenlaista toimintaa miniatyyripeleistä animeharrastukseen. Yhteiset harrastukset muodostavat verkostoja myös pelaajien välille.

Teos avaa roolipeliharrastusta sitä tuntemattommille nuorten kanssa toimiville tai muuten aiheesta kiinostuneille lukijoille.

151218.name: Star Trek (Script Game)
151218.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game represents an unlicensed use of elements of the Star Trek franchise.




Star Trek was a text-based mainframe computer game written by Don Daglow on a PDP-10 timesharing computer at Pomona College in 1972, and upgraded periodically through 1974, including contributions by Jonathan Osser. The game was picked up by the DECUS user group in 1972 and distributed to many universities and other PDP-10 installations around the world, often appearing alongside the ASCII text game Star Trek.

The two Star Trek games were among the most popular mainframe computer games of the 1970s and could be played for free on college computer systems. The script game did not use a graphic sector/quadrant display as was used in the other popular Star Trek game. Instead, it described the action by generating a "script" of dialogue in traditional dramatic format using the names of Enterprise crew members from the popular television series.

Play begins with the player entering a name for the ship's captain. Spock then declares that a Klingon, Romulan or Tholian vessel has appeared on the Enterprise's sensors, and announce its position. On each turn, Sulu or Chekov provide updates on the enemy's position and Uhura asks for the player's orders.

The player issues orders by entering a number (initially from 1 to 10, later as high as 19 as additional orders were added to the code) to tell the crew of the Enterprise what to do. Additional data might need to be entered depending on the particular order. Options include moving closer or farther away from the enemy vessel, and firing phasers or photon torpedoes. The different weapons each have optimal ranges.

After each player turn the results are announced by Spock and then the enemy moves, fires or takes other action. Damage to shields, weapons and engines is reported, as well as the rising count of Enterprise casualties.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Trek (script game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

151219.description:
A traditional Japanese trick-taking card game based on the European game Ombre (originally "l'Hombre"), played with a special 75-card five-suited deck. This deck developed from Tenshō karuta, itself a close copy of the 48-card traditional Portuguese cards called "dragon cards" due to the dragons holding the suit symbols in the aces. Its creation was prompted by a ban on the older form of playing cards after Japan closed off the contact with the Western world in 1633, and became critical towards everything of European origin.

The deck contains all 48 cards from Tenshō karuta; these are supplemented by introducing a fifth suit and increasing the number of cards in each suit from twelve to fifteen. Most additions refer to Japanese and Chinese culture, presumably a conscious choice intended to downplay the European origins of the game.

The suits are はう (hau), "flower" based on Portuguese 'paus' meaning "clubs", いす (isu) a shortened form of 'espadas' or "swords", こっぷ (koppu) from 'copas' or "cups", おうる (ōru) from 'ouros' or "coins" (literally "golds") and finally the added ぐる (guru) with the traditional Japanese 三つ巴 (mitsudomoe) sign as suit symbol. As in the European predecessor games, higher-numbered pip cards beat lower ones only in the former two suits, while the latter ones are "reversed".

The "dragon aces" are split into two distinct ranks by reintroducing a normal "one" in each suit and separate from the ろばい (robai) or "dragon" which normally ranks right above the ones. Above the number cards (1–9 plus robai) there are five court cards. From low to high, these are: そうた (sōta) "queen", うま (uma) "horse", きり (kiri) "soldier" (originally a king), うん (un) various Japanese mythological figures and すん (sun) various Chinese officials. The latter two ranks give the game its name. In the trump suit, the robai is promoted to above the kiri and the sōta above this again, except that the robai of hau is a permanent trump which is the fourth highest regardless of which suit is trump.
boardgameversion: Virginia and Harold Wayland replica edition
151219.name: Unsun karuta

151220.name: Monopolino
151220.description:
Object of the game: be the richest player when the game ends. The game ends when a player runs out of money.

How to play: every player take 10 houses (14 for 2 players). Every player takes 5x1000, 4x2000, 3x3000, 1x4000 1x5000. Players roll the dice to move.

If movement ends on a space without house: the player pays the bank the sum written on the space and becomes the owner. Players that end their turn on this space pay the owner the same sum. If the owner owns all houses on spaces of the same color the sum will be double.

If movement ends on the GO space: the player takes 2000 from bank.

If the movement ends on STATION space: reroll the dice and move again.

If the movement ends on RISK space: draw a card from the deck and follow the instructions.

If the movement ends on CAKE and BALLOON space: the player puts 2000 on LOTTERY space.

If the movement ends on LOTTERY space: the player takes all money on the space.

If the movement ends on GO TO SHOOTING GALLERY space: the player puts 3000 on LOTTERY space and goes on SHOOTING GALLERY space without passing the GO space.

RISK cards with HOUSE written: the player puts his house on a same color space written on card. If all of the same colour boxes are occupied by one player, the player has to draw another card. If the boxes are occupied by different players, the player replaces the home with their own.

151221.name: Kleine Gespensterfreunde
151221.description:
The little ghosts want the midnight party in the old castle, but the common castle cats do not let them inside. Only as a pair of ghosts can float through one of the tower windows. Luckily the fireflies cheer on their friends: Whenever it has managed a pair of ghosts in the castle, a firefly lights are seen! Whoever finds the most ghosts pairs and be the first to get all your own fireflies glow is the winner.
A spooky memory game for 2 - 4 children 3-8 years.

151222.name: Isabella
151222.description:
Isabella, the little witch, is brewing a magic potion. She is throwing all kinds of ingredients in her cauldron. Sometimes she forgets whether an ingredient is already in her cauldron or not. Help Isabella to remember and score wizard hats in return.

Each turn ingredients are placed in Isabella's cauldron. You can score a wizard hat if you can remember which ingredients are in her cauldron. The player with the most wizard hats at the end of the game, wins the game!

151223.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 103 - Sep/Aug 2003)
151223.description:
Aus dem Inhalt:


Novadis vor Neethe
Reichsregentin Emer verlegt Reichskongress
Omlad vor dem Fall
Arvepass zurückerobert
Ruhe in Perricum
Wagenschlacht bei Baliho
Bauernaufstände in Bredenhag
Sieg über die Orken
Adelsmarschallswahl im Bornland

151224.description:
Introduction

Veletas is a drawless territory game for two players: Black and White. It’s played on the squares of a 10x10 square board, which is initially empty. Apart from the board, the necessary material comprises seven shooters and a sufficient number of black and white stones.

This game won (along with Four) the BoardGameGeek Best Combinatorial 2-Player Game of 2013 Award.


Definitions

A piece is a shooter, a black stone or a white stone.

A group is a set of one or more like-colored, orthogonally adjacent stones. The size of a group is the number of stones in it.

A trapped shooter is a shooter that can’t make any legal move in the current position.


Play

The board starts out empty. Black starts the game by placing three shooters on empty squares of the board, and then White places the remaining four in the same fashion. In both cases, no shooters can be placed orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to any other. This restriction doesn’t apply to the rest of the game.

From then on, the players take turns, starting with Black. On his turn, a player can (but is not obliged to) move a shooter to an empty square in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line, without jumping over any other pieces. Then, the player must place a stone of his color on an empty square which is on the same straight orthogonal or diagonal line as the destination square of the moved shooter (or any shooter, if none was moved), with no other pieces in between along that line. This is called shooting. Claimed shooters (see below) can’t move or shoot.

At this moment, if there are any trapped shooters on the board that haven’t been claimed before, each one of them is claimed by the player who owns the biggest group orthogonally adjacent to it. If there is no such group or the biggest such groups of each color are the same size, the shooter is claimed by the opponent. Claiming a shooter is indicated by placing a stone of the corresponding color on top of it. Claimed shooters remain unchanged for the rest of the game. Stones on top of shooters aren't part of any groups.

The game ends when a player has claimed the majority of shooters, i.e. at least four of them. That player wins. Draws are not possible.


Smaller versions

For shorter but still reasonable games, the following variants are suggested:


7x7 board with three shooters. Black places one shooter on his first turn, and White places the other two. Whoever claims two shooters wins.



9x9 board with five shooters. Black places two shooters on his first turn, and White places the other three. Whoever claims three shooters wins.


Online Play


Boardspace.net (real-time, AI option)
151224.name: Veletas

151225.name: Die Reisende Kaiserin
151225.description:
[from the back of the book]
The court of the Empress: a place of authority, chivalry, intrigue. The grandees of the kingdom spend time at the court of Rohajas to bask in the glory of the empire of Raul, and also to exert tangible political power. It takes no wonder that the rulers of Aventuria face the courtyard of the Middle Empire and send ambassadors, diplomats and spies to feel the pulse of the Empire. But the court is not only a place of authority. It is home to the Empress and her family, surrounded by nobles and commoners, knights and courtiers, advisors and sycophants. But it is at it's brightest splendor, when the nobles of the kingdom shall be summoned to the court day to decide the fate of the empire, when tents and halls become places of representation.

Since the imperial court started the eternal journey, it moves from Palatinate to Palatinate, from county to county to bring shine and power to places far from the old imperial city of Gareth. And the call that sends many ministers into sleepless nights lets simple people and the young knights tremble alike with anticipation: "The Empress is coming!"

Die Reisende Kaiserin (The traveling Empress) presents the Imperial Court of the Middle Empire , with its officials and dignitaries , as well as its heroes and villains. In this sourcebook you will find a comprehensive overview of the actors on the court as well as a collection of palaces and imperial fortresses, and a typical meeting of the nobles in the peaceful city of Ragath in Almada.

151227.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 106 - Mar/Apr 2004)
151227.description:
Aus dem Inhalt:


Nostria in Not
Thronerbe, Traviabund und Drachentöter
Die letzte Schlacht um Omlad
Konflikte in hl. Drachenorden spitzen sich zu
Sadrak Whassoi in Gareth
Eine neue Ära im Süden
Rat der Zwölf neu gewählt
In aller Kürze

151228.description:
From the publisher's website:

Alarm in the hen house! Everybody tries to snatch the most egg cards and not let them drop. That is not so easy: whoever receives an egg card has to clasp it under his chin, between his knees or in other very unlikely positions. When it comes to the big egg dance, everybody has to run up to the matching hen ? but keep in mind that scoring is done as soon as one player loses one of his egg cards.
151228.name: Eiertanz, Das Kartenspiel

151229.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 107 - May/Jun  2004)
151229.description:
Aus dem Inhalt:


Neuer Großfürst von Almada
Herzog fordert Albernias Krone
Wurm von Windhag erlegt
Exodus am Jaquir
Neue Königin von Nostria
machtwort aus Kulisk
Oberste Hetfrau gewählt
In aller Kürze

151230.description: The Sorcerer's Apprentices want to go to the castle of the famous wizard, but no one knows the way through the sinister magic forest. That's why they need to find the enchanted mythical creatures that live hidden in the woods. Only they can help the sorcerer's apprentices to reach to the wizard. The aim of the game is to assemble mythical creatures from two cards and to get to the castle of the magician first.
151230.name: Verhexte Fabelwesen

151231.description:
The Missions Expansion is a deck of mission cards, meaning players no longer all have the same objective of just collecting four matching relics. Instead, players draw cards that provide objectives which are more challenging to obtain, and are kept secret.

Contains 16 new stack tiles (marked with an orange flower), and 13 new relic tiles (comprising a new Mask relic for each colour and an additional set of black relics).
151231.name: Relic Expedition: Missions Expansion

151232.description:
This expansion contains two new types of jungle tiles: villages and markets. Villages contain relics for which players must trade supplies; they make some relics more costly to obtain, and they give players a reason to carry duplicate supplies. Markets contain supplies for which players must trade relics; they give players another way to obtain the supplies they need, and they give players the opportunity to remove from the game a relic that their opponents need.

Contains x4 of each new tile type, an additional standard supply token of each type (marked with red text), and 9 green triangular curse tokens.
151232.name: Relic Expedition: Villages and Markets Expansion

151233.description:
A mini-expansion that provides three new small features that require the same equipment as their larger counterparts to traverse, 9 orange triangular curse tokens, and 2 new types of relic tiles based on terrains featured in the core game (Quicksand and Poison Ivy).

These tiles are marked with a violet flower. The expansion also contains a new supply item: the Whip.
151233.name: Relic Expedition: Adventurers Expansion

151235.description: An eight-sided animal die that replaces the six-sided one found in the core game, and includes a new symbol: the question mark. This allows a roller to select any animal type, and move all counters of that type.
151235.name: Relic Expedition: The Wild Die

151236.name: Coaster
151236.description:
Back of Box

Take the ultimate scream test!

You're screaming down the tracks. The G-forces are rearranging your face. And your custom-built roller coaster is heading for hyper-space. But don't wimp out now! After all, you have nothing to lose but your lunch! It's your dream. And your scheme. So relax, sit back and screeeeeeam.

Just Point and Click. It's that easy to use. So, you don't need a PhD to start building your masterpiece ASAP.

Computer Assisted Design. The power of 3-D CAD Imaging is at your fingertips!

In Your Face Action. First-person perspective will send you hurtling down the tracks on a teeth rattling, stomach churning, head spinning rocket ride!

Digital Sound. Disney's sound engineers braced America's hardest rocking roller coasters to capture all the glorious clatter in mind-bending digital detail.

Build Your Own. Or Make a Clone. With the ample variety of track pieces, you can invent the scream machine of your dreams. Build one based on your favorite real-life roller coaster. Or choose from many designs that are pre-built, ready to ride.

Track Your Stats. Coaster's unique Signature feature lets you save and analyze stats like speed, longest drop, G-forces and more, as you shoot for personal bests--or compete with other Coaster boasters.

Ask the Experts. The panel of animated experts will judge your Coaster design and let you know if it's a go!

151237.name: The Habitition of the Stone Giant Lord (and other adventures from our shared youth)
151237.description:
From the Back Cover:

A compilation of eight adventures written by young people during the early days of tabletop fantasy gaming, presented as they were created in original form and format. Includes an interpretative essay by Jon Peterson of Playing at the World.

Part academic exercise, part nostalgic rush, it's a relic of the past you can play.

151238.name: Invisible, Inc
videogamehonor: 2015 CVA Best Downloadable Game of the Year Winner
2015 CVA Best Indie Game of the Year Winner
2015 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
2015 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2015 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
151238.description:
User Summary

Incognita is a turn-based tactical espionage game inspired by xcom. You manage a team of agents in a secure complexe making your way through it's many level gathering intelligence and gear. Information management is key, keep your agents actions secret and try to learn everything you can about your location. The more time you spend in the complex the higher the alarm level will rise and the building's response will increase accordingly.

151239.name: When Worlds Collide: A Role-Playing Game
151239.description:
From publisher blurb:

Infinite Universes
Infinite Possibilities
One Dark Fate…

…your breath is loud in the confines of the helmet, and you can feel your pulse battering behind your ear. This is it. In a moment, you will step through the portal into the energy field. You will be the first human being to ever breach the mantle between dimensions. You can feel your hand shaking as you step forward, reaching out for the eternal unknown. You enter the field, and the sensation of shuddering in your belly becomes more violent. Your eyes seem to become wider as a ferocious darkness begins to crowd in upon you, and your skin begins to crawl, as if pulled by a billion hot fish-hooks. Your consciousness begins to fold in upon itself, like surf crashing on a rocky shore. There are things in your mind, things that you were never aware existed. Whispers, presences, sullen, bloated things sluggishly bubbling at the back of your twisted perception. You feel as if your bones are corkscrewing within your body, your blood boiling into a red chilling mist, fingers coiling back upon themselves within the protective suit. Something is watching you, something cold and malevolent, watching and waiting, salivating with a terrible hunger, whispering your name. Your eyes open; the helmet is cracked and there is a breeze hissing through the broken plastic. There is sunlight in your eyes: the light is red. You try to get to your feet and look around this new world. Earth: but not the earth you left only moments ago. You have survived the first interdimensional transition. You are the first human to have ever shifted from one reality to another. You take a breath and realise that you feel cold. The suit should keep you warm, but your whole body can now feel the breeze upon it. You lift your hand to check the integrity: there is a wave of terror in your heart as you realise that your flesh and the suit have become one. Switching focus to the crack in your helmet, you see a trickle of blood from the damaged portion. The helmet is bleeding. You and the suit have become a single biological entity. The first human to travel to a new reality did not arrive completely human…

When worlds collide reality is no longer trustworthy.

Within this book you will find all the rules needed to create characters and run games within the infinite multiverse. The game provides a comprehensive platform to run any adventure in any genre, be it sci-fi, fantasy, horror, super-hero or cyber-punk. Characters can shift between universes to experience other realities.

Games-Masters can choose to throw characters across the multiverse; one week they are in the old west, the next gothic horror or a future of biotechnological marvels, and the following week? Who knows?

When Worlds Collide is a multi-versal, multi-genre role-playing game. To play, you will need a selection of polyhedral dice (available on-line or at you local hobby store), pencil, paper and some friends.

151240.name: Hell Freezes Over
151240.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are members of a covert organisation that has access to a means to travel between realities. The organisation, known as the Ourobourous Project keeps you on a tight leash: your families think that you are dead or missing, and you are forbidden to engage in intimate relationships with other Project members. The Project owns your lives. Today, the price you paid to be part of this adventure is finally fulfilled: your first mission to an alternative Reality….

151241.name: Into The Green Inferno
151241.description:
From publisher blurb:

Extracted introduction adventure from the When Worlds Collide Main Core Manual.

Wanted: Research assistants for adventurous Expedition to Indonesia. All academic backgrounds considered: Must have parachuting or BASE-Jumping experience. Contact: Prof Jarvis, Palaeobotany Dept Ext 5656. Once in a lifetime opportunity to make headlines in the academic press.

151242.name: The Weight of Light
151242.description:
From publisher blurb:

A salvage crew is needed to recover a research vessel from the surface of Mars. The vessel lost Communications with the Satellite relay system and surface station before proceeding to crash into Mars surface below. The teams on the surface are not geared up for a recovery, but have sent out a search and rescue team to look for survivors, the last report from them advised that no survivors were heard from, but communication stopped some time ago.

151243.name: The Colour of Light
151243.description:
From publisher blurb:

After discovering that a crashed ship harboured more than just salvage your crew narrowly escaped being eaten by space spiders that seem to be eating any matter and even planets in their path. Barely escaping and doing so only at great damage to your ship, you are now accelerating from Mars ,the ship is in need of urgent attention, and you still need to warn Earth of the danger that is approaching.

151244.name: Table Pack 18: Haunted House and Tee'd Off
151244.description:
User Summary

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Haunted House was released in 1982 by Gottlieb. As the name suggests, it is set in a Haunted House. It was the first table to have a triple playfield accessible by a single ball. The basement is below the main playfield visible through a clear window and the attic is a raised area to the top-right of the playfield. Eight flippers are used to navigate around the different levels and rooms of the House.

Tee'd Off was released in 1993 by Gottlieb. The aim is to complete rounds of golf to activate various multi-ball modes. Your efforts are hampered by the mischievous Gunther the Gopher, an animated representation of whom appears sits above the back-glass. This is a complex table, with five rounds of golf, each of which need 9 holes to be completed by hitting specific targets (or hitting a 'hole in one').

151245.name: Table Pack 19: Class of 1812 and Victory
151245.description:
User Summary

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Class of 1812 was released in 1991 by Gottlieb. The playfield includes an animated, severed hand, chattering teeth and a beating heart! The main aim of the game is to to light all of the Bonus Levels in order to resurrect five characters, known as Stiffs.

Victory was released in 1987 by Gottlieb. The table is themed around motor-racing. It was the first table to have a photo-quality mylar overlay on the playfield, rather than the hitherto standard paint directly on wood. The main aim of the table is to finish the race by completing seven Checkpoints by completing specific shots. Completing checkpoints quickly is the key to a high-score, as completing each checkpoint starts a bonus counting down. At the start of the game, the bonus is 100,000 points, completing the first checkpoint scores the current bonus and resets the countdown to 200,000, and so on with the bonus increasing for each checkpoint.

151246.name: Table Pack 20: Cue Ball Wizard and El Dorado City of Gold
151246.description:
User Summary

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Cue Ball Wizard was released in 1992 by Gottlieb. The game is themed around playing a game of Billiards in a Western bar. The playfield features a full-size cue-ball. The main aim of the game is to complete six wagon-wheel objectives. These range from 'Rowdy Ramp' which gives 17 seconds to shoot the Ramp as many times as possible, to 'Spell Double' which requires all the letters in D-O-U-B-L-E to be collected. Interestingly, the letters carry over from ball-to-ball and indeed game-to-game. Completing all the wagon-wheel objectives activates Pool Ball Mania, a 3-ball multiball mode. At the conclusion of Pool Ball Mania, 9-Ball Play can be activated. Hitting 7 drop targets in order, collecting the 8-ball and then the 9-ball drop target scores half a billion points - or one billion points if D-O-U-B-L-E is lit!

El Dorado City of Gold was released in 1984 by Gottlieb. The table has an exploration, adventure theme as you search for treasure in the jungle. The gameplay is classic, with the main aim to increase the bonus and multiplier by completing two banks of Drop Targets, and to obtain Specials (extra balls).

151247.description:
In the card game Greed, crime lords (the players) try to earn more money than anyone else through clever use of their cards.

At the start of the game, each player receives a random hand of twelve cards from a deck of 80. Players draft one card, pass the remaining cards left, draft a second card, pass again, draft a third card, pass again, then the game changes; players simultaneously choose and reveal a card, carrying out its effects, then they draft another card, pass the remaining cards, play again, and so on until ten "playing" rounds have passed, at which point the game ends and players tally their holdings.

The card types are thugs, holdings and actions. Thugs and holdings might have a cost to be played (perhaps cash paid to the bank or the discarding of a holding) or a condition that you must meet (having two thugs, for example, or a collection of symbols on cards in your possession) in addition to an effect, which is unique to each card. (Each action has a unique effect as well.) When you play a holding with one or more symbols, you place a token on that card for each symbol on it and an additional token for each symbol of that type already in your possession. These tokens are worth $10k each at the end of the game, and you add this value to whatever cash you've collected through your card plays.
151247.name: Greed
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 026 – Random Top 10 Games
Episode 46 -- Card Drafting and Other Mishaps
Episode 81-- Gen Con 2014 Top 11 to Try and Top 11 to Buy with special gues W. Eric Martin from BGG News
Podcast: Diógenes Busca Juego 04 – El doble filo del Crowdfunding
The Game Pit: Episode 25 - Treasure Hunt - Part Two
The Game Pit: Episode 30 - Picking Over the Bones
The Game Pit: Episode 40 - Council Chamber Mega Review of 2014 with Top 5s

151248.name: With Ketchup
151248.description:
Dragons like Knights, and Knights like Dragons... With ketchup!

2 players face off, one as the Dragon, and one as the Knight.
Winner of 2 out of 3 battles between 3 (or 4) unique match-ups of a Dragon and a Knight. Is it the Plate armored Knight vs the Hatchling Dragon, or the peasant wearing Quilted armor vs the Ancient Dragon? You won't know until you flip your Armor Cards!

Each player has 4 levels of protection (Armor) as well as Effort cards and Weapon Cards.
The Knight can attack with a [Mighty] and [Good] Effort with his [Razor Sharp] [Halberd] for 11 points, or if his hand is full of weak cards, he'll be forced to make a [Pitiful] Effort to attack with his [Crossbow] for 2 points.
What to play, what to hang on to? Deceptively simple, with a deeper strategy.

Whoever defeats their opponent by reducing their Health to zero in combat will have dinner when they're done.

151249.name: Snow Ball Fight!!
151249.description:
Snow Ball Fight!! pits 2 teams of kids (5 kids per team) in a snowball fight to the last man standing! Each team member has a number, and a color, so your little one can practice matching and identifying their colors and numbers.

Draw cards from the draw pile and see if you hit someone, miss, or miss by elimination (each kid can only be hit once), and be the first to decimate your opponent!

151250.name: TP'd
151250.description:
You and your friends have sneaked onto the Johnson's property, and now it's time to TP their trees!

Each player has a picture mat with a Tree on it, and a complete deck of TP/Hazard cards. Your goal is to TP as much of the tree as possible before the cops show up, while dealing with Hazards which will remove your TP.

A Deck contains 2 complete games; 2 Play mats and 2 complete decks of cards with different colored backs to help identify which deck they belong to.

The game can be played solitaire (using 1 deck and 1 Mat), or versus; each player using a mat, combining the decks into 1 big deck, and playing the Hazards on each other!

Three different color sets are available, allowing up to 6 miscreants to be TP'ing the Johnson's trees at once!

151251.description: In Castle Crush!, players build their own castles using wooden blocks while trying to attack castles owned by others with a wooden hammer. Players not only need to know how to attack effectively, but also must create a strong castle in order to defend against different types of attacks. Whoever collects the most points wins!
151251.name: Castle Crush!
boardgamepodcastepisode: MOBG 43 Christmas Special episode
The Game Pit: Episode 33 - Essen 2014 Treasure Hunt Special (Part 3)
The Game Pit: Episode 37 - Essen Brief with Natalie
The Game Pit: Episode 38 - The Big Essen 2014 Review

151252.description:
Der Catanische Rat (The Council of Catan) is a visual point counter developed for the expansion Explorers & Pirates, but can also be used in Catan basegame or any other expansion.

Each player has a flag that shows the points they have. For every new point the player wins, the flag is moved one step higher.

This expansion can be bought at Catanshop.
151252.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Der Catanische Rat

151253.name: Final Assault
videogameversion: North American Apple II gs edition
151253.description:
From the back of the box:

If you're afraid of heights, forget it! You're at the foot of one of the world's highest mountains. Awaiting you are snowy slopes and crevasses, icy glaciers and jagged rockface. Get ready to experience the intensity and elation of one of the most grueling sports ever.

Start by choosing from six treacherous trails. Or practice your skills on the training course first. Then pack your rucksack--carefully. The items you choose are critical to survival. Select departure time and season, and the trek begins.

You'll be tested every step by changes in terrain, weather and your health. You could fall thousands of rocky feet. Or freeze to death in a blizzard. Or you just might be one of the lucky few to plant your flag at the peak.


Three types of challenging terrain on each trail with beginner, intermediate and advanced levels.



Choice of over 50 items to pack in your rucksack, from climbing gear to food supplies.



On screen features include the time, temperature, altitude, and climber's physical condition. Even a safety guide to help in the climb.

151254.description:
A promotional pet initially given with copies of the expansion Dark Alleys upon its launch at Essen Spiel 2013. There is an extra set of fasteners for this pet in the Dark Alleys expansion.

Bob the Blob: Originally, this pet had no name. And no shape. And no personality. No, wait, that’s not true. Actually, Bob’s personality is very well defined: He is eager to please. That’s why he lets us call him Bob, and that’s why he will be whatever you want him to be.
151254.name: Dungeon Petz: Bob the Blob Promo Pet

151255.name: Monopoly: VfL Wolfsburg
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
151255.description:
Monopoly with VfL Wolfsburg, a soccer team from Germany.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

151256.name: Monopoly: Schwabing
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
151256.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Schwabing, a district of Munich, a city in Germany.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

151257.name: Monopoly: Hanau
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
151257.description:
Monopoly set to Hanau, a city in Germany.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

151258.name: Monopoly: Witten
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
151258.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Witten, a city in Germany.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

151259.name: Verrückt
151259.description:
Verrück doch mal
German text on backside of the box: In diesem spannenden Spiel wird versucht, durch Bildung möglichst vieler und langer Wörter die meisten Punkte zu erzielen. Durch das Verrücken von Buchstabenchips muss ein Wort gebildet werden, wobei jeder verwendete Buchstabenchip Punkte bringt. Auch Sonderpunkte sind möglich. Die Spieler sind abwechselnd an der Reihe, wodurch sich immer wieder neue Möglichkeiten ergeben. Optimales Wort gefunden? Oder sind etwa noch mehr Punkte möglich? Flexibles Denken ist hierbei gefragt. Doch Eile ist geboten, denn die Zeit läuft ab.

English: Try to get the most points by creating the most and the longest words. Build it by shifting letter chips, every chip counts. Players alternate, so every time new chances occur. Found the optimal word? Or are more points possible? But do not dawdle, time runs short.

151260.name: Journey: Wrath of Demons – White Bone Demons Expansion
151260.description:
As our Pilgrims cross a desolate and craggy mountain pass, they unknowingly stray into the land of the White Bone Demons. At first, the band meets a few skeletal warriors, possessed bones of a long dead army, risen to serve their Queen. After battling against the more corrupted White Bone Demon forms, the Pilgrims find that their Cleanse Ritual is not so effective against these Demon-possessed skeletons. Finally, the narrow path takes them to the Forbidden White Cave, where the Pilgrims confront Yara, Queen of the White Bone Demon Clan, who realises that this is no ordinary group of mortals. If Yara can eat the flesh of Tripitaka, she can gain immortality, regenerate her flesh and regain her beauty. As she launches her minions into a pitched battle, the fast moving White Bone Demons scuttle across the battlefield and Yara herself joins the fray.

Will Yara’s poisoned attack will be the end of our four travelers? There is more at stake than just the Pilgrims lives. If they can defeat Yara and the White Bone Demon Clan, Tripitaka will recover the second piece of the lost Sutras and will be one step closer to restoring the seal on the Underworld.

As normal for expansions, this is not a standalone product. There will be a rules supplement, but it will be based on the Journey rulebook. You will play with some Map Tiles and Bridge Tiles from Journey and the base rules are the same. But the expansion is more than different shaped playing pieces. The White Bone Demons play very differently to the Bull Demons, being faster and harder to cleanse. Faster means it is easier for the Pilgrims to get overrun. With the Cleanse Ritual being less effective, Pilgrims will have to risk more kills and Bad Karma. You will need new strategies to defeat the White Bone Demons.

Finally, there is a new game mechanic. The White Bone Demons are the reanimated bones of long dead warriors. Demon Spirits possess the bones and over time, warp them in to horrific shapes. This separation between the Demon’s spirit and the warrior’s body may explain why the Cleanse Ritual is harder, but it is certainly the explanation of the biggest surprise the Pilgrims will face. Dead White Bone Demons are left on the board and if Yara can attract another Demon Spirit, these piles of bones may spring back to life!

151261.name: You Ain't From Around Here, Are You?
151261.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Well, pardners, that weird rift-thingie done gone and dropped you right where you don’t belong, and that’s no mistake. This here’s not where you is supposed to be, this is a land of injustice and exploitation, where a misplaced word can be answered by the bark of a six-shooter.”

But that isn’t all. This is a world very different from yours, where Europe has been abandoned and the Old Countries have risen again in the New World. The sky is wracked by electrothermal storms, only kept at bay by pylons topped with a special refined ore that in its natural state phases in and out of reality.

Worst still, your arrival may not be as accidental as you think…

151262.name: Born From Disaster
151262.description:
From publisher blurb:

A team from an oil drilling site in the gobi desert is being swapped out with a relief crew when during their flight home they are hit by a storm. Unfortunately the storm does more than delay the flight and the effect on the team might be a lifelong experience for them.

151263.name: The Next Stop on the Curve
151263.description:
From publisher blurb:

After surviving a whistle stop tour of your history you found yourself in a World War II Bomber on a bombing run which didn’t end in a pleasant experience. You and your team had to ditch and found yourself in the jungle inside enemy territory. Now with no obvious ways to return to your own time you need to nd your way to safer ground. From what you can remember of your history there should be some resistance around here and hopefully not too long till peace is declared.

151264.name: The Warmth of Light
151264.description:
From publisher blurb:

After surviving an onslaught of dark spiders you managed to limp away in your space ship only to be told to turn around and stop them from reaching earth. After attempting to cease the progress of the spiders by overloading your engines you have found yourself on a planet. Could the ship have been blown back to earth? You should be dead but instead you are awakening in the ship that is crashed into a planet. Time to find your welcoming party and find out how bad the day can get.

151265.name: Vampire Holocaust
151265.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Team arrive in a quiet suburban street somewhere on the English coast. The place is deserted. Why? Where has everyone gone? They soon learn that the world has fallen to a terrible disease, transforming people into infectious, blood-hungry demons. Most of the native human population has been evacuated to safe-zones in the middle of the world’s oceans. Here and there pockets of survivors hunt the beasts down, trying to make the world clean again. But there is a secret lurking here; a secret that could damn the rest of the human race to extinction…

151266.name: Journey: Wrath of Demons – Spider Demons Expansion
151266.description:
The Spider Demon Expansion gives the Pilgrims a chance to retrieve the third piece of the sundered Sutras. But before Tripitaka can assemble more of the sacred scroll, his band will have to defeat the Spider Demons. The book describes them as “seductive spider spirits, half beautiful women, half spider”.

In the Silk Cave, high in the Silk Mountains, Zige the Spider Demon Queen spins her webs of the toughest silk. Her minions weave traps of sticky cobwebs and wait for unsuspecting prey to become ensnared. Will they feast on our brave travellers?

Once again, we will introduce new game play elements with the Spider Demons. These Demons fight at longer range, spitting poison and throwing spider web nets. Pilgrims will be more likely to suffer on-going conditions, like Poisoned and a new condition Entangled. Webs act as traps that hold the Pilgrims and attract the Demons when the Pilgrims are entangled. Each Demon moves towards the closest entangled Pilgrim, and may get to attack while the Pilgrim is unable to defend: an entangled target cannot use the Defense Dice.

151267.description:
Two players are prospective sheep farmers aiming to herd the most Sheep from a Flock.

Every turn, players will choose one card from their hand and play it face-down in a Flock, while saying "bah" for each Sheep on the card. Players can choose to tell the truth or lie about how many Sheep there actually are. Once there are seven or more "bah"s said between all players, a player can summon the Dog and say "bark, bark, bark!" If there's no Wolf, the player can pick up the Flock and check for the Wolf. If there's no Wolf, the player can harvest some Sheep, getting them closer to victory, or if there's a Wolf, it has eaten some Sheep! Players can also accuse one another for playing the Wolf, with game-altering consequences. Accumulate 9 sheep during the game and you win!
151267.name: A Wolf in Sheep's Clothing

151268.name: Frozen: Free Fall
151268.description:
Get ready for an epic puzzle matching adventure in the Kingdom of Arendelle, inspired by the newest Disney animated film, Frozen! Join Anna, Elsa, and more of your favorite characters on a journey to slide and match 75 icy puzzles for free!

Source: The Publisher Website.

151269.name: Giant Boulder of Death
151269.description:
When a boulder holds a grudge, no one survives. Bowl your way down the mountain and destroy everything in your path. Crush villages, cars, yetis, golden cows, crush everything!

- CRUSH legions of outrageous mortals, beasts and buildings
- SMASH through over 60 nail-biting goals
- OBLITERATE your high score with boosts and upgrades
- DEMOLISH goals to unlock over 70 new destroyable objects
- DOMINATE your friends via Facebook and Game Center
- MASTER multiple control schemes: tilt, tap or joystick
- ROCK OUT to the hottest yodeling soundtrack of the year

WEAR your finest lederhosen with renewed pride and REVEL in the century’s most yodel-tastic (and FREE) gaming sensation!

Source: The Developer Website.

151270.name: Divvy: The Pirate Loot Game
151270.description:
Being a pirate is dangerous, filled with adventure and wonders to be seen. However all of that is not why we do what we do. We do it for the loot, the gold gems that sparkle and drive us insane. All the bloodthirsty pillaging, all the cannon fire, it's all to get the loot. Once the voyage is over, it's what we wait for, the Divvying of the loot!

In Divvy, you take the role of pirates on a voyage. Each round is a voyage to obtain loot for the crew. On your turn, you pick a mission for the crew to go on, and attempt to complete the mission. Completed missions give you infamy among the crew and places money through the hold of the ship. At the end of the voyage pirates take their share of the loot, and voyage once more.

The first pirate to have enough gold to retire from the violent lifestyle wins!

151271.name: Dumb Ways to Die
151271.description:
Control characters from the original animation in a bunch of frantic minigames, Warioware-style, and try not to die horribly.

Protect private parts, clean up puke, feed picky rattlesnakes, have patience at level crossings, collect characters for your train station, get silly level completion bonuses and take the Red Button safety pledge.

The game is short and sweet but hopefully a fun way to hang out with the original characters some more. (And hopefully still a good reminder to be careful around trains.)

Source: The Developer Website.

151272.name: KickShot Soccer Strategy Board Game
151272.description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

There are One Bra-zillion™ ways to score with KickShot and Rio-lize™ your soccer goals. KickShot® is a board game for 5 year old kids through adults that closely mimics an actual soccer game. Play KickShot with dice, action and referee cards to strategically move the ball across a board, intercept, and score goals. The game supports three levels of play depending on age and desired challenge.

Learn proper ways to execute soccer action with endearing characters
- Move the ball down the pitch with action cards
- Earn referee cards for penalty, corner kicks, offside and direct free kicks
- Advance through three levels of play: kids "grow" from Junior, Warm Up and League Games

KickShot Board Game and all the associated products make ideal birthday and holiday gifts, and fundraisers for soccer clubs and non-profits. The products will surely get the entire family into the spirit of World Cup 2014.

151273.description:
The players are miners, whose objective is to transport bags of silver from their mine to the harbor of Vera Cruz (end space).

It's a simple roll and move game. When the meeples land on a marked space, the players have to follow the instructions in the rules. While passing through the "Indian Gorge" the meeples are in danger from an Indian, who is moved, whenever an odd number is rolled. The player who is the first to reach the end space is the winner of the game.
151273.name: Abenteuer in Mexiko

151275.description:
Ophir is a pick up and deliver, set collection game set in an ancient, prosperous world for 2-4 players. In Ophir, you're an influential person of government, trade, or religion with a singular focus - the construction of the Temple.

The Temple is built layer by layer through collective contributions of Silver and Gold. These precious metals are delivered by your merchant ship for Victory Points at the Temple, one of the seven locations you'll be visiting in Ophir.

To afford these precious building materials, you must navigate the region's seas against your rivals to collect goods to fulfill the demand at the Market for Coins, or exchange them for Favor at the Temple.

Well-timed trades, efficient cargo storage, and tactical transportation will be the keys to your success. But you must be swift in your travels, because the game ends immediately once the construction of the Temple is complete. Will it be you whose name is spoken alongside the stories of Ophir's wonder?

With its approachable map and exclusion of direct conflict, Ophir has a familiar and accessible atmosphere that families will enjoy. But with its modular setup, exclusive player roles, and mercurial market, Ophir has tactics, replayability, and tension for experienced gamers to savor!
151275.name: Ophir
boardgameexpansion: Ophir: Additional Specialists – Postmaster and Peddler
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 22 - We All Stand Together
TDT # 411 - Wood and Cardboard
The Long View - Quick Looks #3
Vox Republica 083: Gaming Outdoors
Vox Republica 084: Terra Nova Games

151276.description:
The year is 2013. It's been 150 years since RoBooth was defeated at the great Battle of Gettysburger, and things are finally back to normal. Pixel Lincoln is running for president once again, but has a new thorn in his side…. multiple versions of his 16-bit self. It's weird, confusing and retro! Which Lincoln will become president? Which Lincoln is the real deal? Who has the better Beardarang?

Oh, and Lincoln's hat is missing again and the world is doomed again with all of that time travel stuff….

Pixel Lincoln: Re-Election is a 4-part expansion to Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game, consisting of new abilities, card types and game modes, but with a whole bunch of what we already know and love: Items, Enemies, Bosses, Mini-Bosses, Characters, Secret Items, and more!

This expansion was designed for the people.
151276.name: Pixel Lincoln: Re-Election
boardgamepodcastepisode: AUG The Game of Crowd Funding Jason Tagmire Interview 12-18-2013

151277.description:
Chikken is a game of dice, risk, strategy, and luck. It's designed for two to six players of any age, as long as they can understand how to make matches with dice.

The goal is to get as high a score as possible without losing your turn. To do this, you roll five special dice (four white, one red), each with one side blank. The red die is called the "Danger Die." If at any time you roll all white blanks, or you roll a red blank, your turn ends without scoring.

You score points by making three/four/five-of-a-kind matches or a straight (1-2-3-4-5). After each roll, you can stop and bank your points (gaining bonus points for matches, plus the total of all spots on the dice), or you can set aside dice of your choice and reroll what's left. However, you MUST set aside any blank white dice after each roll.

An added element of risk management comes when you have a bonus score available, such as from four-of-a-kind. When you do, you have the extra choice of hanging onto those bonus points and rerolling all five dice, with the bonus score still in jeopardy if you should roll blanks and lose your turn. This lets you "start over" with a higher starting value, but all the same risks of losing your turn.

Educational Value

Chikken teaches kids to understand and analyze risks. For younger kids, it's a matching game, and for slightly older ones, they can count up spots, or add up the numbers as they go. And it's still fun for everyone!
151277.name: Chikken

151278.name: Oceanhorn: Monster of the Uncharted Seas
151278.description:
SET SAIL AND EMBARK ON AN EPIC JOURNEY
Grow from a boy to a legend.

Explore the islands of Uncharted Seas, a world filled with many dangers, puzzles and secrets. Fight monsters, learn to use magic and discover ancient treasures which will help you on your quest. Use all your wits and skill to unravel the mysteries of ancient kingdom Arcadia and sea monster Oceanhorn.

Oceanhorn combines captivating storytelling, breathtaking 3D visuals and exciting gameplay into one massive action adventure experience you will never forget.

Enjoy an incredible soundtrack from the best video game composers in the world:
Nobuo Uematsu (Final Fantasy*) and Kenji Ito (Seiken Densetsu*)

Master the game effortlessly with accurate touch controls or iOS7 Controller.

Source: The Publisher Website.

151279.name: Onmitsu
151279.description:
Onmitsu is a Print-and-Play "small card" game. Besides the rules, the whole game is contained in one 54-card deck of cards.

In Onmitsu, you are a spy – an Onmitsu – a sort of spy slash messenger slash ninja slash espionage secret kind of sneak. Your job is to deliver a scroll with a message to your Lord’s boss, the Daimyo. You have a sealed scroll – but so does everyone else. Nobody knows how has which one, either.

Only one message is the “real” message. Others are decoys (which need to be delivered, but aren’t worth as much) and at least “Poison” scroll – a scroll with a hidden message to kill the bearer. Someone doesn’t trust you very much…

Your job is to not only deliver the scroll, but figure out which one you and the other players have. You can always crack yours open to find out, but if the Daimyo shows up before you repair it (or pass it off on some other spy) you are in trouble.

Game play is simple – you draw and discard to form a hand of cards, each of which can be Locations or People. All of them give you the ability to perform actions like steal cards, repair broken scrolls, gain intelligence, or other forms of intrigue.

You win by having the most points, earned by delivering the most important scroll, accumulating cards, and not being the messenger who gets killed.

151280.name: Kingdom Land
151280.description:
The King of Kingdom Land has perished and left his subjects with no heir to rule their fair land. Enter the Barons who all vie for the crown despite their colorful quirks. Using their followers and keen sense of tactics, players will use their baron to jockey for position and finally take rule of the land.

In Kingdom Land players will take on the role of Baron's vying for the vacant throne. Players will roll custom dice in an effort to build up specific types of followers all while trying to gain majority over the regions that make up Kingdom Land. Players will also have the opportunity to learn specific tactics and build monuments which with further increase their chance of dominance. After six rounds Kingdom Land will be evaluated and the Baron with the most points will fill the empty throne of Kingdom Land and rule forever!

151281.name: Rugrats Water Fun Park Adventure Game
151281.description:
Race your favorite Rugrats character along the colored path and up the Super Slide steps. The first character to reach the top and slide down into the middle space is the winner!

On your turn, spin the color wheel and move your character forward to the first space that matches the color on the spinner. If you land on a ticket space, spin the wheel again except this time you will move along the path that matches the symbol that the wheel stops on. Once you reach the Super Slide and spin the red or blue color, drop your character down the chute. If you land in the middle window, you are the winner!

151282.description:
The feel of the wind on your face, the sight of the finish line just over the next snow bank…and the elation of rocket-jumping over evil trees while being chased by a phalanx of chainsaw-wielding snowmen! It’s the wild challenge of extreme downhill sledding against a hill of crazy, zany, fun obstacles in Toboggans of Doom!

Includes 3 Promo Tiles:
Presidential Co-Pilot Upgrade
Distracting Assistant Obstacle
Psychic Rat Obstacle
151282.name: Toboggans of Doom: Promo Tile Set

151283.name: Feudalizm
151283.description:
Feudalizm is a strategy game set in a medieval atmosphere. The player takes on the role of a local prince and expanding the power of subordinate lands. The game offers a wide range of possible actions: construction of castles, towns, cities and rural location, construction of business facilities, trade, sieges and assaults of castles or towns. The action is varied random events in the form of cards. The modular system allows the board to change its appearance at each game.

Each player starts the game with the disposal of city, a sum of money, a certain amount of raw materials and the deployment of troops and several farm buildings. The player's task is to manage the development of his principality by building new business facilities, colonize new areas, increasing the strength of the army, the establishment of villages and towns, castles extension locks. The main objective pursued by each of the players is dominance over its rivals, which can be obtained on how the economic or military conquering lands belonging to the opponents.

The game is divided into rounds, each round corresponds to one seasonal: spring, summer, autumn, winter. During each turn a player can perform up to four specific actions. The game ends when one player has to fulfill the conditions of economic or military dominance over their opponents.

The basic raw materials present in the game are : wood , stone , ore, iron , food , horses, consumer goods , and weapons and armor .

The game includes a deck of 30 cards random discovered alternately by the players. There are also so-called card . advisors drawn or selected before the start of the game . Features counselors have a significant impact on the course of the game.

The currency of the game are known. kordyty denominations of 1 , 2, 5 and 10 Outbuildings, workers, settlers , towns and villages are in the form of cardboard chips. Castles in the discretion of the buyer may be in the form of chips or resin models.

In choosing the path of military conquest available to the player are various units : light and heavy cavalry , infantry peasant, municipal police, swordsmen, axemen, halberdiers, archers, crossbow and machine battle . Battles can be resolved in a very fast manner (for the impatient players) , or on the board battle (for players with a strategic verve ).


Jest to gra osadzona w klimacie średniowiecza. Gracz wciela się w rolę lokalnego księcia i rozbudowuje potęgę podległych sobie ziem. Gra oferuje szerokie spektrum możliwych akcji: budowa zamków, grodów, lokacja miast i wsi, budowa obiektów gospodarczych, handel, oblężenia i szturmy zamków lub grodów. Akcję urozmaicają wydarzenia losowe w postaci kart. Modułowy układ planszy pozwala zmieniać jej wygląd przy każdej rozgrywce.

Każdy z graczy rozpoczyna grę mając do dyspozycji gród, pewną sumę pieniędzy, określoną ilość surowców i oddziałów wojska oraz kilka obiektów gospodarczych. Zadaniem gracza jest kierowanie rozwojem swego księstwa poprzez budowanie nowych obiektów gospodarczych, kolonizowanie nowych terenów, zwiększanie siły armii, zakładanie wsi i miast, rozbudowa grodów w zamki. Głównym celem do którego dąży każdy z graczy jest dominacja nad rywalami, którą można uzyskać na sposób gospodarczy lub militarny podbijając tereny należące do przeciwników.

Gra podzielona jest na tury, każda tura odpowiada jednemu sezonowi: wiosna, lato, jesień, zima. Podczas każdej z tur gracz może wykonać do czterech określonych czynności. Gra kończy się w chwili gdy jeden z graczy spełni warunki dominacji gospodarczej lub militarnej nad swymi przeciwnikami.

Podstawowe surowce występujące w grze są : drewno , kamień, żelazo , rudy , jedzenie , konie, dobra konsumpcyjne , a broń i zbroje .

Gra zawiera talię 30 kart losowych odkrywanych na przemian przez graczy. Występują również karty tzw. doradców losowane lub wybierane przed rozpoczęciem rozgrywki. Cechy doradców mają istotny wpływ na przebieg gry.

Walutą w grze są tzw. kordyty o nominałach 1, 2, 5 i 10. Budynki gospodarcze, robotnicy, osadnicy, miasta oraz wsie występują w postaci kartonowych żetonów. Grody i zamki w zależności od uznania kupującego mogą być w formie żetonów lub żywicznych modeli.

Obierając drogę militarnego podboju do dyspozycji gracza są różnorakie jednostki: lekka i ciężka jazda, piechota chłopska, straż miejska, miecznicy, topornicy, halabardnicy, łucznicy, kusznicy, oraz machiny bojowe. Bitwy rozstrzygane mogą być w sposób bardzo szybki (dla niecierpliwych graczy), lub na planszy bitewnej (dla graczy z zacięciem strategicznym).

151284.name: Kingdoms CG
151284.description:
Simple card game for 2-4 people.

Players are trying to form their own province in a kingdom using 5 different characters.

Players must always look after single provinces to make sure that each of them makes the maximum income to the royal treasury. Once shall you overlook any bad thing about any province and it will pull your growing kingdom back. And also neighbors will never leave you in peace trying to advance their kingdoms and take a piece of other lands.

151285.name: Floden Sover 2000
151285.description:
User summary:

A surreal freeform game, which goal is to break down the regular boundaries of freeform role-playing. Some of the players read prepared monologues out loud, while others act out the events.

151286.description:
Two or four player soccer game using metal miniatures; players each have 1 field player and 1 goalie, using a ball that position determines the possession/active player. On a board with checkerboard patterns different areas (dark & light) determine who's next to kick (dark or light team).

The player puts the field kicker next to the ball and releases its leg to kick the ball. The other player should try to block the kick with his/her goal keeper. After the kick the possession is once more decided and the same procedure starts all over again.

Goalies can be managed by two other players, game lasts 2 x 10 minutes.

Remarks: Game was produced during 1930's; 'Wunderteam' was a specific name for the Austrian national soccer team during the years 1931 up to 1933.
151286.name: Wunderteam

boardgamecompilation: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Extreme Danger Kickstarter Bonus Pack
151287.description:
Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Critically Wounded Victims is a Kickstarter promo given to backers of the Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Extreme Danger Kickstarter campaign. The promo consists of three special POI tokens with a victim and a black cross that can be added to the game.

A critically wounded victim cannot be carried until they have been treated by the medic. Once treated, they act as untreated victims in that they are carried rather than led.

Critically Wounded Victims cannot be treated by the medic more than once.
151287.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Critically Wounded Victims

151288.name: Flipp und Flapp
151288.description:
Objective: get familiar with additon/subtraction of small numbers
- collection of a few different math games for preschoolers -

1. Be the first to reach 10 exactly: put on appropriate math sheet, turn the spinner and add or subtract shown number.

2. Be the first to get rid of your 11 wooden slides with different numbers: put on appropriate math sheet, turn the spinner and solve the math formula by filling in the correct slide.

151291.name: Collision
151291.description:
Collision is a super-hero deck building game, created by Magenic Technologies. In Collision, players play as software superheroes (The Automator, The Architect, The Oracle, Big Data, and The Mechanic) to build a deck utilizing additional heroes, super-powers, gear, and additional equipment to fight villains big and small, from small bugs all the way up to the evil Retrograde and Rain Cloud.

On each turn, the active player plays cards from their hands. Most cards in the game yield from 1 to 5 power, which is the main currency of the game. Other cards allow manipulation of the player's discard pile, drawing additional cards, ridding the deck of unwanted cards or additional bonuses. Having accumulated power during their turn, players finally use their power to purchase additional cards to increase their deck's strength. Each card purchased is worth victory points, and the person who has the most victory points at the end of the game is the winner!

151292.name: The Petersen Bestiary Volume 1
151292.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A free selection of new monsters for Torchbearer.

David Petersen, author of Mouse Guard, has teamed up with the Torchbearer (2013) crew to create monsters for the game. Five new creatures to vex adventurers and please GMs!

151293.description:
This laser cut accessory fits precisely over the top of your faction player mat, providing spaces for each building, power disc bowl, ship and shovel level. In addition, each overlay comes with an innovative interchangeable corner section allowing for the 2 “special” factions that are dramatically different than the others.

Each set is comprised of 5 Bases, 5 standard Faction Corners, and 1 each of Mermaid and Fakir Faction Corners. All of the components are laser cut from 3mm Acrylic and may contain a protective film/paper on one or both sides that is easily removed.

- - - We have been made aware of thickness variability in the production process of Acrylic. Normally this would not be an issue as each overlay or tracker was its own independent entity. However, with this overlay implementing interchangeable parts it is conceivable that you might notice it. Even though we are attempting to cut each set from the same sheet, the variations still persist, so there really isn't anything to be done except let you know about the potential cosmetic inconsistencies. - - -
151293.name: Terra Mystica: Acrylic Overlay Set

151294.name: Black Streams: Cults of Ruin
151294.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gain further insight into the dark powers of the Sunset Isles with Cults of Ruin. Inside this free supplement you'll learn truths about five different foul sects. The devotees of the Black Emperor, the slaves of the Hell Kings, and stranger faiths still are given in this text along with guidelines for using them in your own campaign.

As a bonus, you also get the Azure Inquisitor, a Labyrinth Lord-compatible class dedicated to the rooting out of vile cults and secret cabals.

While written for the Red Tide Campaign Setting and Sandbox Toolkit, this supplement's information is easily reskinned for your own home campaign, with abominable faiths and foul creeds for your heroes to smite with righteous fury.

151296.name: One Hand Gives, the Other Takes Away
151296.description:
user summary

Entry for the 2013 Fan-sponsored, Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay scenario contest

From the adventure synopsis step 1:
The party is recruited by Graf Brucher and invited to go on a brief expedition to recover some stolen heirlooms.

151298.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 112 - Mar/Apr 2005)
151298.description:
Aus dem Inhalt:


Krieg zwischen Albernia und den Nordmarken
Hüter der Flamme beigesetzt
Zwergenrat in Ingrahall
Überfall auf Palmyrabad
Blutige Ernte in Gorien
Versagen des aranischen Militärs
In aller Kürze

151299.name: Codex of the New Earth: The Cult of the Wraith
151299.description:
From publisher blurb:

He Who Sees, Lord of the Watchers.

Among the maddened courts of the Crazed the Wraith is riddle even to his foes. For two hundred years Solomon Nkwame has fought an unending battle against his demented peers, his loyal Watchers striking from the fog of precognitive invisibility and maiming rival cults with secrets stolen from within their own ranks. Does the Wraith truly seek to liberate the New Earth from the scourge of the Crazed, or does he merely desire a world scraped clean of his rivals?

In the Cult of the Wraith you will learn of Nkwame's polymorphic past and get the tools you need to decide his own role in your game. Is he a valiant protector from a lost age, a bringer of knowledge and freedom from the agonies of the Crazed? Or is he only a more seductive kind of lunatic, a deceiver who lures his minions in with hopes to feed their desperate desires? Design the Wraith's back story to suit your own game and let your players discover the truth as best they can.

Inside, you'll find...

Details on Solomon Nkwame, the mysterious Crazed known as the Wraith.
Information on his secretive cult and the forbidden training in psychic mastery that they offer the desperate outcasts of the New Earth.
Statistics for his cult members and the arch-psion himself.
The nullifying art of Abnegation, a brand-new psionic discipline to use in your own game.




Cult of the Wraith is written for the Other Dust post-apocalyptic role-playing game, but its contents are fully compatible with the free Stars Without Number role-playing game, including a section on using the Wraith in your far-future campaign.

151300.name: The House of Bone & Amber
151300.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Streets of Paraku Groan....

A furious priest shouts curses from the Shrine of the Seven Red Miracles, and the merchants mutter of thieving Nebeti and their damnable ways. The Nebeti elder lies dead by the amber pits, and the Oba struggles to contain the anger of his people. Old grudges are rising, old hates are waxing strong, and the good people of Paraku fear that the streets will soon run red. Who will help them break the grip of the vengeance that even now rises with fire and spear?

In this new adventure for Spears of the Dawn and other old-school games, characters of levels 1-3 face the fury of a divided city and the scars of a wound that even now threatens the people of Paraku.

The House of Bone and Amber gives the details of the jungle city of Paraku and its stern people. Within you will find a fully-developed city for your game, along with the hidden temples, dungeons, and blasphemous libraries of the fallen House itself. Thrill to the grim tale of the green stone bowl and the doom it threatens upon the bitter city and discover for yourself the awful fate that awaits its people. Heroes are needed in this burdened land, brave souls to strengthen the hands of the good citizens of Paraku and break the knives of those who would welcome a dawn of smoke and blood.

While The House of Bone and Amber is designed for level 1-3 characters created with Spears of the Dawn, a conversion guide provides for a quick and easy transposition of the module into your own favorite old-school rule system. Along with that convenience, the module has been designed to be easily sliced apart into urban details, local NPCs, and long-buried levels of the House itself for you to recycle and repurpose for you own game worlds. Even after your mighty heroes have faced the grim green doom of the city, you can easily strip out the levels and city portions they never touched to help compose their next thrilling tale!

151301.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 144 - Nov/Dec 2010)
151301.description:
Aus dem Inhalt:

Spielhilfe: Magierorden für Spieler
Spielhilfe: Der Spiegelpalast zu Zorgan
Szenario: "Zerbrochen"

Inneraventurische Nachrichten: Die Kaiserin bietet Hafax die stählerne Stirn.

151302.name: Portes, Monstres & Trésors (1st Edition)
151302.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vous êtes un incurable nostalgique qui garde telle une relique sa précieuse "boîte rouge", un jeune rôliste curieux de savoir à quoi jouaient les Anciens, ou tout simplement quelqu'un qui veut un jeu de rôle médiéval-fantastique simple mais complet ? Portes, Monstres & Trésors est fait pour vous !
Ce jeu complet et gratuit en version PDF est une traduction et une adaptation du contenu en Licence Ludique Libre de Labyrinth Lord, jeu écrit par Daniel Proctor et édité par Goblinoid Games. Comme son modèle, PMT émule les mécanismes de la version B/X de D&D (celle parue en 1981). Les connaisseurs remarqueront que nous avons rajouté deux règles optionnelles : le jet de sauvegarde unique et la classe d'armure ascendante.

Pourquoi ne pas avoir fait une VF officielle de Labyrinth Lord ?
Tout simplement parce que les négociations avec Daniel Proctor au sujet de la licence Labyrinth Lord n'ont pas abouti. L'essentiel de Labyrinth Lord (le texte et les cartes) est sous Licence Ludique Libre, mais pas la marque "Labyrinth Lord" et la mise en page : c'est pourquoi nous avons dû adopter une nouvelle mise en page et trouver un nouveau nom pour cette traduction.


Translation:

You are an incurable nostalgic that keeps their relic like the precious "red box", a young gamer curious to know what the elders played, or just someone who wants a simple but complete medieval fantasy role playing games? Portes, Monstres & Trésors (Doors, Monsters & Treasures) is for you!
This free and complete game published as a PDF is a translation and adaptation of the Open Gaming Licensed Labyrinth Lord, written by Daniel Proctor and published by Goblinoid Games. As a model, PMT emulates the mechanisms of the B/X version of D&D (the one published in 1981). Connoisseurs will notice that we have added two optional rules: the unique saving throw and increasing armor class.

Why not make an official French version of Labyrinth Lord?
Just because negotiations with Daniel Proctor on the Labyrinth Lord license have failed. While most of Labyrinth Lord (text and maps) is Open Gaming Licensed, the brand "Labyrinth Lord" and the layout are not, which is why we have adopted a new layout and found a new name for this version.

151303.name: Portes, Monstres & Trésors: Kit d'introduction
151303.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ce kit comprend une version abrégée des règles, suffisantes pour jouer une aventure de niveau 1, ainsi que l'exemple de labyrinthe fourni à la fin du chapitre 8 du livre de base Portes, Monstres & Trésors (1st Edition).


Translation:

This kit includes an abridged version of the rules, sufficient to play an adventure level 1, as well as the sample maze provided at the end of the 8th chapter of the base book Portes, Monstres & Trésors (1st Edition).

151304.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 150 - Nov/Dec 2011)
151304.description:
Aus dem Inhalt:

Aventurische Meisterpersonen: Salpikon Savertin, Lucardus von Kémet
Ortsbeschreibung: Der königlich Palast von Mirham

Inneraventurische Nachrichten: Ein Ritter ohne Wehr

151306.name: Zauberspiegel - Im Banne Zaccatas
151306.description:
from the back of the book, user summary

Zauberspiegel - Im Banne Zaccatas is a universal adventure modul for 4 to 6 players of mid expierence level. This book contains serveal small scenarios/adventures in a pseudeo egypt setting. exotic location and creatures await the players. The players will step by step become more involved by the evil demon Zaccatas.

151307.description:
Robin Hood and his gifted team of young vigilantes must help the downtrodden people of their land and deal with evil plots of the Sheriff – before finally meeting up with the villain himself in a final showdown to decide the fate of the Nottingham Sector.

This is a fully cooperative game which takes place over a series of rounds. Players must work together, pooling their time and resources, to contend with sinister plots affecting the Nottingham Sector.

By rolling specific types of dice (Combat, Stealth, or Diplomacy), players may choose how best to resolve the Plots. At the end of each round, the Threat Level may rise, making subsequent rounds much harder.

In the end, the players will have to push forward through the Sheriff's fortress-like Factory to confront the villain himself!

Only through careful management of the dice, tactical decisions about how to resolve the Plots, and a little luck of the roll will Robin Hood and his heroic team win the day!
151307.name: Robin Hood 2888

151310.description:
FAQ
Q: What happens when the Event deck runs out on Board 4?
A: Since there are no Treasures to lose, you instead move the Dragon an additional space to the right.

The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug is an exciting game of adventure in which you join Bilbo Baggins™ and his 13 dwarven companions on their journey through the Mirkwood Forest and Laketown, to the goldfilled caverns of Lonely Mountain. Along the way The Company will encounter spiders, elves, orcs, and finally the dragon Smaug himself.

Traverse your way through two boards, each more difficult than the last, with the goal of coming out alive and prepared for the dangers that lie ahead. Your accumulated points at the end of the game will be your group’s mark for finding out how good of a team you really are!
