New elements not found in the first game include “The Dragon’s Path” and the “Dwarven Barrel Escape.” Each adds new twists and tension to the game. Combine the two games for a wild ride and see how well your team can do!

This is a standalone game, but it’s also an expansion to The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey.

Game Box Contains:

2 Game Boards
36 Event Cards
1 Resource Board
2 Treasure Tiles
6 Custom Dice
4 Cheat Sheets
1 Dice Bag
1 Dragon Pawn
14 The Company Tiles
4 Victory Point Markers
10 Resource Tiles
15 Quill Markers
1 Rulebook
151310.name: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug

151311.name: Duck Dynasty: Redneck Wisdom
boardgamepodcastepisode: Duck Dynasty Redneck Wisdom Family Party Game
151311.description:
A trivia game about the popular TV series, Duck Dynasty. Answer questions and complete famous quotes to see who knows this show better among your family or friends! Fool other players with your believable answers and spot the genuine quotes from among the decoys to score.

Players race to answer the most questions correctly for the first player/team that makes it once around the board wins!

Contents:
1 Answer Pad
1 Die
1 Game Board
4 Movers and 4 Mover Bases
130 Quote Cards
70 Trivia Cards
10 Rules Cards
Game Instructions

151312.name: Armies of the Dead
151312.description:
Each player starts with four dice of each of six types (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, and d20), and the first to lose all twenty-four dice loses the game. Each battle is different according to the terrain dice thrown, which determine how many and which dice may battle, if any are modified/doubled, and how many actions each player may take per turn. Each type of die has basic abilities (resurrection/banishment, mimicry, split attacks, join-forces, re-roll opponent die/dice, re-roll own die/dice), and all but the d4 have special abilities activated by rolling pairs (or more) of the same number.

The player with initiative (usually lower total roll) takes one, two, or three actions (based on the throw of the terrain dice) before the opponent has a chance to respond. Actions include one die attacking another or activating abilities, or activating abilities and then attacking an opponent's die (most common).

There is a balance between thinking through the possibilities and over-thinking what your opponent may do, particularly in the selection of which dice to roll at the beginning of each battle. Each battle will consist of different combinations of dice, resulting in different abilities interacting, keeping the game fresh and interesting throughout.

151315.description:
The First World War is over and it is time to choose your side. Underground secret societies, or rather cabals, are battling for world domination. Containing spies, witches, faeries, magicians and other creatures from all over the world you must select your cabal wisely.

Cabals: The Board Game brings together key deck building mechanics with board control in a new battle that can either be won through board domination or conquering the opponents stronghold. Once the battleground has been constructed the luck of the draw and your deck building skills dictate what creatures you have at your disposal. Units battle one another backed up by spells and lead by a single hero for your deck from one of the four cabals.

The turn sequence comprises of gaining domination points, gaining resources, drawing cards, the main strategic phase (containing combat) and ending your turn. Resources dictate what cards you can use and this combined with loyalty points (depending on the cabals and their allegiances) the player has a deep, strategic game to conquer on many levels. The game is based on the digital Cabals: Magic & Battle Cards and these same key mechanics prevail but this version has more streamlined gameplay suitable to a tabletop game.
151315.name: Cabals: The Board Game

151317.name: Battle of the Alamo
151317.description: This is a game about the Alamo with a military theme. Designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, or 4 players ages 10 or older with different skill levels for each age group. One player represents the Alamo defenders. The other player or players represent the attacking Mexican army. The outer pathway is a square depicting the walls of the fort. The inner pathway is a circle depicting the interior of the fort. Players move along the outer pathway by throwing dice and drawing event cards. Once a breach has been created the action moves to the interior for a final showdown. Includes tournament rules for a five game series to create play balance for the beleaguered Texans.

151318.description:
Objective: Be the first racing to position '100'

Typical 'Roll & Move' game from the 1910's in Germany. Roll the die by turns and step forward - until you end on a special field - follow instructions glued on lid inside.

Special rules: players are kicked out / must start again if touched or passed by others. Use 2 dice before passing space 84.
151318.name: Wintersport

151319.name: Alarm! U-Boot!
151319.description:
What is it all about?

Two fleets fight against each other during the game. Their aim is to destroy the enemy’s Command Ship. However this is a hard challenge because the game offers several options to obstruct or threaten the enemy’s vessels. Planting sharp mines in the route of the ships is one of them, or you may choose to bluff and plant fake mines that look exactly like real ones...

How does it play?

- Every turn the active player rolls a die. The die shows how many actions you have to take in your round: 1, 2 or 3.
- After you roll, you can plant mines on empty fields if you want.
- Now choose a ship and spend your actions. Turn, move or shoot. Every ship type has its unique weapons, and specific role in the battle.
- The first player who hits their opponent's Command Ship is the winner.

What this game offers:

- short, simple, easy-to-understand rules,
- quick set up, no more than 5 minutes after the second game,
- relatively short rounds (30-45 minutes), no time to get bored.

151320.name: Aberrations
151320.description:
From publisher blurb:

Generating treasure hordes can be a time consuming task, so the work has been done for you. Pre-generated treasure saves you the hassle, with 6 hoardes to randomly choose from for each APL(average party level) from 1 to 20 and treasure quantity, from incidental to triple.

The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game has rules for creating different hoardes for the various monster types. This volume covers the treasures found on or with Aberrations, those being with strange anatomy, bizarre abilities and alien minds.

These results assume that a medium level of advancement is being used. If you are not using this method, then you need to adjust the result accordingly.

151321.name: Animals
151321.description:
From publisher blurb:

Generating treasure hordes can be a time consuming task, so the work has been done for you. Pre-generated treasure saves you the hassle, with 6 hoardes to randomly choose from for each APL(average party level) from 1 to 20 and treasure quantity, from incidental to triple.

The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game has rules for creating different hoardes for the various monster types. This volume covers the treasures found on or with Animals. Could this be from their prey or simply a magpie-like curiosity?

These results assume that a medium level of advancement is being used. If you are not using this method, then you need to adjust the result accordingly.

151322.name: Constructs
151322.description:
From publisher blurb:

Generating treasure hordes can be a time consuming task, so the work has been done for you. Pre-generated treasure saves you the hassle, with 6 hoardes to randomly choose from for each APL(average party level) from 1 to 20 and treasure quantity, from incidental to triple.

The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game has rules for creating different hoards for the various monster types. This volume covers the treasures found on or with Constructs, those animated objects or artificial life forms. Constructs (Guardians) will have their own edition, once the main monster groups have been done.

151323.name: Grove of Hands
151323.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 32 x 30 inch, full color floorplan of a strange grove.

The Product comes with the Hex, Square and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“Whatever ritual they are performing, I think we should stop them. I don’t think we will like the result!”

Grove of Hands is a single map of a clearing in a forest with an odd collection of pillars and hand-like statues. Grove of Hands includes a 360-degree panoramic view.

Grove of Hands is intended for fantasy or horror-themed games.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

The Awakening: While traveling in the forest, the group comes upon a gathering of men and women with black robes having green and brown embroidered trims. They are chanting loudly and praying towards the pillars and statues. It is up to the group to investigate or interfere with the ritual if they wish. If the group interferes, the cultists scatter. If the group tries to take the sword, the hand statues awaken and attack the group to stop them from stealing the sword.

If the group waits, the cultists finish their ritual. The hand statues pull up a massive body from underneath the ground below, the earth swallowing up many of the surprised cultists. The hands attach to the four pillars, clicking into place. Two of the hands act as legs, two as arms, and the other hand is where a head would be. The cultist leader then directs the massive statue to head towards the nearest town… Its up to the group to then stop the massive monster directly or try and defeat the leader of the cultists, hoping that it stops the statue’s rampage.

151325.name: Acts of Villainy Gangs: Redcaps
151325.description:
From publisher blurb:

Acts of Villainy: Gangs is a spotlight on villains created by Sketchpad Studios. Every release will focus on a new, villainous gang for enjoyment in your new or existing adventures! Pit your heroes against these baddies, and enjoy endless hours of adventuring!

THE REDCAPS!!

Just when you thought it was safe to walk the city streets again, a gang of cackling criminals comes out from the underground interested in not only stealing your wallet, but you life as well! Beware, citizens and heroes alike, for the Redcaps are on the loose and they'll do whatever their leader, Redjack, wants!

151326.name: The River Bank Will Make A Mighty Good Road
151326.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is the responsibility of all agents of the Time Patrol to be prepared, at a moment’s notice, to travel into any point in the past, to prevent the mysterious Tocks from making alterations to history. Today’s mission will bring a team to the 1820s, visiting the small town of Throop in rural New York; but to what end? The motives of the Tocks are mysterious at the best of times, but on this mission, there’s more going on than meets the eye.

This is a standalone adventure for the Fate roleplaying game, along with the Time Patrol background material. The adventure is suitable for roleplaying newcomers as well as experienced Fate players, and is paced to work in limited-time settings like conventions as well as in regular session play. You will need the Fate Core rules.

151327.description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Armies boast about their strength and courage, but none are so fool-hardy as to boast that they could fight a dragon. You're tougher than an army, though, right?

More Options

Fires of Fury is a Foe deck with particularly powerful crown Foes. Although you don't have to kill them at first, they inflict damage on their way past and at the climax of the game they all appear at once.
151327.name: Bulwark: Fires of Fury

151328.description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Jedrzej lived to fight, and that meant death for those he fought. After years building a reputation as a combatant to be feared, there was little left that could stand against him. When at last he returned to his home, he found his tribe annihilated and its customs forgotten. In his zeal for the thrill of battle, he had lost sight of its cost. He resolved to keep his axes at his side unless he found a good enough reason to heft them.

More Options

Jedrzej the Hurler is a new Hero deck, fully compatible with the base game. He brings a little of everything to the table - multiple attacks, strong attacks, ranged attacks, Wound removal and Wound denial.
151328.name: Bulwark: Jedrzej the Hurler

151329.description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Someone once called Baron Miksa a 'slimy, double-crossing swineherd'. That man disappeared in mysterious circumstances, at around the same time as the foundations were laid for the Baron's new castle. The Redoubt is a stronghold built to be secure on a budget. Alas, the Baron seems to have underestimated the forces it needs to hold against.

More Options

Miksa's Redoubt is a location with plenty of fortification cards, requiring forward-planning to defend effectively. With little on offer to get rid of unwanted cards, you have to take every potential wound seriously.
151329.name: Bulwark: Miksa's Redoubt

151330.description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

When a gang of bandits gets too big for its britches, it dreams of conquest, of over-running an established kingdom and living an easier life. A pipe-dream, naturally, but such gangs can wreak havoc in their attempt.

More Options

The Steppe Bandits is a Foe deck that interacts significantly with Heroism cards, and can sneak up on you with ambushes.
boardgameversion: First Edition print and play version
151330.name: Bulwark: The Steppe Bandits

151331.description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

What better location to defend than a muddy mess of a riverbank near a strategically-important bridge? After all, without the inconvenience of stout walls, gates and so forth, you can see all of the enemy arrows on their way to you. Unless, for some reason, you think that might be a bad thing...

More Options

Traitor's Crossing is a location with plenty of defender cards, meaning you can build a successful deck with relatively few hero cards.
boardgameversion: First Edition print and play version
151331.name: Bulwark: Traitor's Crossing

151332.description:
This is a set of three cards to mix into the base cards of CV:

Boardgame designer: spend two happy faces and two light bulbs to receive a happy face, a light bulb, and a relationship icon each turn.

Boardgame collection: spend three dollar signs to receive one victory point at the end of the game and one relationship icon each turn.

Trip to game fair in Essen: spend three dollar signs to receive two happy face icons once.
151332.name: CV: Promo Cards

151333.name: Inertia
151333.description:
Inertia is a game of unification in the sense of Claude Soucie's Lines of Action. The first player to unite all of his pieces on the board into a single group wins.

To start, white places one piece anywhere on the 8x8 square board. Players then alternate placing pieces on the board, with the first piece being adjacent to the opponent's most recently placed piece and the second piece being adjacent to no pieces, either orthogonally or diagonally.

Once a player can't place a second piece, the placement phase ends and the next player starts the movement phase. On a turn, a player moves one piece akin to a queen in chess, with movement ending after passing through any number of empty spaces or by landing on an opponent's piece and capturing it. If this move increases the total number of groups on the board — with a group being a single stone or a series of straight- or diagonally-connected like-colored stones — then the move is illegal. Gameplay continues until one player unites all of his pieces into a single group; if he simultaneously creates single groups for both players, then the game is a draw.

Instead of using a chess board, Inertia can be played on a hexhex board with pieces moving like hex rooks.

151334.description:
The evil empire is divided. Amidst the chaos, several overlords emerge to claim rule over all by raising great armies of hellish creatures. They all yearn for power but only one will emerge victorious.

Overlords is a set collection, card drafting game for 2-4 players. Each turn, players recruit one card from their hand and then pass the rest of their hand to the player on their left. Every time a card is recruited, it goes into that player’s army pile. Only the top card is visible in each player’s army at any given time. There are two types of cards available in the game—Monster cards and Hired Hand cards. Each Monster card has a unique scoring mechanism. Players must recruit them wisely in order to maximize the amount of points of their army. Hired hand cards are placed separate from an army and, when activated, have special abilities that affect the game. The player who raises the most powerful army, wins! .

Overlords easily plays under 20 minutes. The game is simple to teach, yet tough to master. There is even a 2 vs 2 option that allows for some interesting team play.
151334.name: Overlords: The Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: AUG Micro Game Contest 7 Finalists Feedback

151335.name: Ruinen des Schreckens
151335.description:
from the back of the book

The power of the evil

The spirit of king Ethelwaines who gets insane and chaotic by dirty betrayal and imprisonment for hundreds of years. The priest of death, who guard the soul of Etherwaines and all the other martyred that the never gets free and take awfull revenge

The power od the good

The all know about the horror that lays in those ruins, but no one was willing and brave enought to confront it until a holy order - not barley unselfish - wants to ends this goings-on and sends out a group of adventures. And those adventures are you!!!

user comment
Ruinen des Schreckens is the german language Generic / Universal publication of Evil Ruins

151336.name: Tod einer Priesterin
151336.description:
from the back of the book

Tod einer Priesterin (death of a priestess) is an universal adventure for mid-experienced heroes.

Surrounded by magic fire the dark priest appeared on the opposite waterside - At her side a creature, half human, half animal, with a body of a male and a heat of a deer. With a mighty jump the creature cross the river and attacks. Nobody can resit her, no weapon can harm it. The companion call their gods in despair. One flash hits the ground, a deafening thunder follows. And there where the paladin stood a silver-white stallion appears ....

151337.description:
Game manufacturers McLoughlin Brothers produced a group of several games, during the late 19th century, called "The Merry Christmas Series." It is likely that the firm marketed these games especially at holiday time, to take advantage of the gift-buying public.

The Game of Merry Christmas Goose Chase is a simple racing game where players try to catch a Christmas goose. This game is targeted toward young children.
151337.name: The Game of Merry Christmas Goose Chase

151338.name: Zauberwelten (Issue Autumn 2013)
rpg: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying

151339.name: 252-NEWS (Issue 11 - May 1992)
151339.description:
Aus dem Inhalt:


Die runden Schiffe
Piraten!! Piraten?!? Ein Szenario
Talislanta
Kartenspiel mit einem Spectre
Das Tor zwischen den Welten
De Fabula Bestia II
Die Rache des Reums
Eine Prinzessin zu befreien
Aktion Fandom

151340.name: Sòcc'mel
151340.description:
A trick-taking card game focusing on expressions from Bologna's dialect. Players try to avoid taking suits of unlucky events going around the table by either adding a more powerful event of the same sphere, or trumping the suit with an event of a different sphere (the three spheres being home, work or street). If not avoidable, the trick taking can be mitigated by playing a swear word card, or by a Socc'mel card, which transfer the suit to another player. Goal of the game is pushing the other players anger-meter ("incazzometro") beyond 10 to eliminate them from the game.

The game is marketed for ages 6 up, with the explicit proviso that obscenities from Bologna are widely accepted and not considered offensive (which is the case, to some extent...).

151341.name: Barter
151341.description:
From the back of the book:

Power is Stuff...

Money in Frankenstein Atomic Frontier is represented by Barter – a number on your character sheets denoting small, tradable items that can be exchanged for goods and services. But what is Barter? Wonder no more! Inside this book you’ll find rules for describing precisely what a character is carrying and detailed descriptions of why it’s useful!

Barter, for Frankenstein Atomic Frontier, also boasts:

Ω Detailed prospecting tables for wasteland finds
Ω Rules for prospecting, scavenging and re-purposing
Ω New Folks, Bad Guys and Special Parts
Ω Bonanza City! A fully detailed Settlement built on Barter, easily incorporated into any Frankenstein Atomic Frontier game
Ω A dire secret for Game Masters to torment their Players with...
Ω One Spare-Part length adventure
Ω 100% Australian RPG Product

151343.name: Hokuspokus Krötenfuß!
151343.description:
There are 5 different ingredients and the raven cards what count as a jokers in this game.
The object of the game is to collect the most cards in one type of ingredient.

In start each player gets 3 cards and the rest of the cards are placed to 5 pile. Put the frog aside to any pile.

In his turn player rolls the dice to move the frog as many steps as the dice indicates. The player takes top card from that pile.
Now he asks any ingredient from any player and also announces the ingredient he must give back. If that player has the ingredient he must give all cards with this ingredient with the current player.
Game ends if one of the five piles is exhausted:
The player with the most cards with one type of ingredient is the winner.

151344.description: The Legends Board Expansion includes two additional double-sided board pieces that can be added to Eight-Minute Empire: Legends so players have a total of six double-sided pieces from which to create the modular map.
151344.name: Eight-Minute Empire: Legends Board Expansion

151345.name: "Klipp Klapp"
151345.description:
Players take turns dropping their 5 marbles down the channels of the game, trying to get as many marbles as possible down to score at the bottom (hole with different values).

Winner is the first player to exceed 500 points.

Remark:
Published late 1950/early 60's.

151346.name: Subterfuge
151346.description:
Subterfuge is a 2-player, luck-free, abstract strategy game played on a standard chess /checkers board using 12 standard dice (6 each in 2 separate colours).

The game has many similarities to chess but uses d6 dice as the pieces. Each player starts with their 6 dice in their home territory and they advance into the field to play. Players alternate moving one of their pieces with the winner being the first player to capture 4 of their opponent’s pieces.

The value of each die face determines the movement and capability of the piece – smaller values move lesser distances but can Capture larger dice – higher value dice move greater distances but Expose smaller dice - equal value dice Influence the value of neighbouring dice, including your own. Pieces may move forward or backward according to the movement rules defined for each die facing.

Stuterfuge includes many layers of strategic play and brain-burning tactical play, as the dice values change throughout the game. Game length can vary between 15 to 60 mins, depending on the time permitted for each move. Multiple variants are also included in the rules, allowing wildly different tactics and play for each game.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
151347.description:
Millennium Blades is a CCG-Simulator -- A game in which you play as a group of friends who play the fictional CCG "Millennium Blades".

In this game you will build decks, play the meta, acquire valuable collections, crack open random boosters, and compete in tournaments for prizes and fame. The game takes you from Starter Deck to Regionals in about 2-3 hours.

Multiple games can also be chained together to form a Campaign, going from Regionals to Nationals in game 2 and from Nationals to Worlds in game 3, with each game introducing ever more powerful cards and higher stakes, but also resetting the power of the game so that each player has a fair chance to win each 'season' of the campaign.

The game draws heavily on Manga/Anime inspiration for its art, and parodies Magic: the Gathering, Yugioh, and many other collectible games.

At its heart, it’s a commodity trading game, except that instead of cubes or stocks, the things you’ll be buying, selling, and speculating on are trading cards that can be used throughout the game in periodic tournaments. By trading wisely, playing the market, working together with friends, building collections, and winning tournaments, you’ll secure points and become the Millennium Blades World Champion.

The game features a system of card pods, where you will play with about 400 of the base game’s 600 cards every game. The Kickstarter project will help us to bring this ambitious game to life with high production quality and additional cards that will increase replayability and variety.
151347.name: Millennium Blades
boardgamepodcastepisode: #36: 2016, A Year in Review
14. Devon Dice Podcast - Runemeet vs the Spiel Des Jahres Nominees
Boardcast News 4.30.15 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers

The Good The Board and the Sorry for being late: episode 13 Worker Placement
Vox Republica 121: Meeples (And Humans) Included
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 83!

151348.description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target (Dresden) moving by turns - "Roll and Move" game.

Move forward according die roll along the red line; if you end on a blue marked space follow the blue line until you join the red line again.

If you end on a green marked space, follow the green line back to the red line.

Equipment: board, 8 meeples (can be extended), 1 die

Probably published during the 1950's.
151348.name: Kreuz und quer durchs Sachsenland

151350.name: Beneath the Shadowheart
151350.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unable to gather information concerning the Trypus Academy's growing influence in the Great City, the PCs plot to return my baking a run through the Dungeon Under the Mountain. They seek to establish an underground safe-route to help others escape from the inquisitions, as well as gather intelligence against their nemesis, the Trypus Academy.

Beneath the Shadowheart is an adventure for Season II of the Great City: The Sinking adventure serial. It was designed using the Pathfinder RPG system and intended for a group of 10h-level Player Characters

151351.name: Знаменитость
151351.description:
"Znamenitost" means Celebrity in Russian. It's a quiz game with a unique mechanic that provides infinite questions, and you don't need a game master to play it.

There are 4 different kinds of decks (24 cards per deck, 96 total).
1. Facts: each card represents a fact from a biography (for example, "She wrote a book", "Something is named after her", "She was imprisoned", etc.).
2. Professions, such as "politician", "actor", "soldier", etc.
3. Alphabet: each card is a letter, which should be the first letter of someone's name, surname, pseudonym, or nick name.
4. Countries, such as "USA", "Germany", or "Russia".

Each round one of the players chooses a deck, reveals the top card and reads its text aloud. Then everybody tries to name a famous person that matches the task of the card. The fastest player reveals the top card of one of the remaining decks, and now the players try to name the person who matches two criteria, and so on.

For example, if the cards "C" and "She wrote a book" were revealed, it's possible to name Julius Caesar, Winston Churchill, Clive Barker, or any other person with the first "C" in his/her name (or surname, or nickname) and known as an author. If nobody could name a person after the next card was revealed, than the player who had correctly named the previous person wins a round. You cannot reveal more than 4 cards (one per deck): if someone has managed to name a person with 4 cards, he wins that round.

The game is played till one of the decks is depleted.

Contents:
96 cards (24 per deck)
2 blank cards for your own tasks
rules

151352.name: The Fire Within: Codes and Principles
151352.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the character building tool you need.

It is a personality tool to define what a character believes in. There are 73 codes outlined here, 146 is you include anti-codes. These are the individual, personal rules that defines what a character believes in; what they live for...what they would die for.

Codes are defined as simply as possible so you can start putting this powerful tool to use right now!

Take the extra step in character desihn that separates a simple piece of paper from a vivid character that lives and breathes in your imagination.

151353.description:
Two different boards:

1. Uhrenspiel
Objective: move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. Learn to read a watch.
The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".
Ending on a 'white' space move foreward according to the printed watch, on a 'red' space backwards.
Can be played by 2 persons or 2 teams.

2. Snakes and Ladders
151353.name: Es läuft die Zeit... wir laufen mit!

151354.name: The Tower of Dr. Alienstein (Revised)
151354.description:
From publisher blurb:


Generic Adventure Location for Your Role Playing Game

Its Alive-Alive!

A creepy, crumbling tower sits out in the middle of nowhere, surrounded by a run-down graveyard. Loud laughter erupts from the confines of the shadowed place. Thunder cracks and lightning crackles, drawn to electrical rods on the roof. In that moment of brilliaqnt light all manner of horrors are glimpsed: strange, abominations shambling about the grave yard, a hulking brute on the roof; and a tall, pale alien thing in a lab coat. As the rain pouds down. You check your weapons and move in.

Get ready for frightfully creepy entertainment, as the players in your role playing game must confront the uncanny horrors of this unique location, rich with campy creatures and sinister alien plots. It is timeless pulp, fitting for the late Victorian through today. The game includes gamemaster maps of each level, descriptions of abominations and the masters of the tower, Dr.
Viktor Shelley and the menacing Dr. Alienstein. The book is generic and easily adaptable to most games, but just in case, we have included an alternative skill system and conversion tables so that you may more easily bring this hide-away of horrors to your gaming table. Need some unusual twists, we have included the Cosmic Eye; a series of tables to help you find inspiration and keep your ideas fresh and lively...er, well...un-lively…anyway. Easy to use comparative tables help to describe how the ranks in the game measure up to the real world.

The characters are easily adapable, with their conditions and abilities described in simple terms. You will be up and running in minutes. Have a blast and well...break a leg. Don't leave it behind; there is no telling what Dr. Alienstein might do with it.

Good Horror Stories Always Have Sequels

There are over 25 Story Hooks to Keep Your Characters Guessing. Our story hooks provide you with inspiration and alternatives for what type of story you may want to run. These story hooks, range from the macrabre to the kooky.

What this Book Contains


Four Levels of the tower, one sub-level, and the roof
Descriptions of Dr. Viktor Shelley, Dr. Alienstein, the Creature; and a group of undead, scientifically augmented monstrosities.
Over 25 story hooks to keep the stories coming
The Cosmic Eye, a collection of tables that make answering simple questions a lot more fun
Comparative Tables to gain real perspective of what the simple ranking system means
Conversion tables for converting the generic ranking system for statistics to other common dice mechanics


It's Like a play set for RPGs. The Tower of Doctor Alienstein is a generic product, intended to be dropped into a pre-existing campaign. All descriptions and statistics are given in broad, easily adaptable terms.

Weirdly horrific, this book will quickly be one of your favorites. Definatly an adventure location that will be talked about again and again.

151355.name: Skill Encounters
151355.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gostor is a Grumpy Old Schooler's Take On Rules. A series of product aimed at providing, simple yet robust rule additions to expand the game

Skill encounters provide the author and game master with a framework for skill-based encounters using the Pathfinder system or the 3.x version of the world’s oldest role-playing game.

A full description of the philosophy behind what a skill encounter is and why is it different from other encounters. Three fully statted out encounters are provided within.

151356.name: Pit of Pillars
151356.description:
Pit of Pillars is an elimination game of placement of men, and moving and capturing stacks. Every capture results in a pillar being erected on the square where the capture took place. Pillars belong to the captor and move as chess queens. They can neither capture nor move over pieces.

Stacks can be split or joined. Whether a stack is vulnerable to capture is determined by the number of adjacent squares. Pillars take away such squares and thus heighten vulnerability of adjacent stacks.

A player wins by eliminating all of the opponent's stacks from the board (regardless of any reserves either player might have in hand) or by leaving his opponent without a legal move. Cooperative cycles are inherently possible, but in regular play the game will seldom end in a draw.

The game can be played using simple generic material: a chess board, draughtsmen, and chess pawns to represent pillars.

151357.description:
SEVEN is a tile-stacking game that uses polyhexes of 4 hexagons, called tetrahexes. There are 7 different tetrahexes (hence the name of the game).

Players alternate turns placing one of their tiles according to some simple rules, trying to get the most of their pieces on the topmost layers when the game ends.

The rules also include a variant and some puzzles.

SEVEN is the little brother of Pent-Up
151357.name: SEVEN

151359.description: Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Colored Miniature Bases is a promo with special removable bases for the miniatures in the game. Each base has different colour, one for each of the six player colours. This makes it easier to tell who is playing what character.
151359.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Colored Miniature Bases

151360.name: Jaywalkers
151360.description:
Jaywalkers is a two player game, played on the spaces of a 8x8 board.

2 pawns in two colors and 62 path tiles.

SETUP - Place board between players, pawns start on any space of each player’s respective first rows.

PLAY – A player on his turn must take two actions.

1.Place a tile onto an empty space.
2.Move your pawn in a series of one or more rook moves over any number of tiles following any one of three paths shown on a tile you're currently moving over and ending the move on an empty space.

RESTRICTIONS – The tile you placed on your turn must be part of the route your pawn takes. A pawn may not land on a tile. Your pawn may not jump over your opponent's pawn.

ENDGAME – You win if your opponent is unable to take his two actions.

151361.name: Shadow Societies
151361.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most creatures that come to the attention of the Order are lone predators or members of a small pack or cult. They may be dangerous adversaries – red in tooth and claw, or wielding foul sorceries – but they tend to be isolated threats. They lack the co-ordination and resources guardian priests can bring to bear. Such enemies are dealt with swiftly and without mercy.

In recent years, however, it has become apparent to the Masters of the Order that other forces are at work in the world. These are not just mindless monsters or heretical rabbles but organised and purposeful groups whose powers are not to be underestimated and whose goals are dark and fathomless.

As always, the Order must respond. It must adapt and counter these new challenges, in order to see His Will done and Christendom protected.

But can the truth be uncovered in time? And even then, can mortal man hope to stand against such ageless adversaries when, for so long, they have gone about their work undetected?

Presented within this book are details of some of the mysterious groups whose activities threaten not just Christendom but the world itself. Many of these organisations are centuries old, with schemes and ambitions set to play out in the years ahead. They can provide even experienced guardian priests with new and diverse challenges – and move the events of a Deus Vult campaign far beyond the relative safety of northern Europe to the Holy Lands and beyond. For, just as the Order is increasingly aware of these shadowy groups, so they too are taking a greater interest in the warriors of the Mont St. Michel.

These include Malik Dhukan, the exiled King of the Djinn; strange were-races of the Scions of Zeus; and mysterious eastern sorcerers from far Cathay.

But fear not brothers and sisters, for ours is a divine calling and we shall not be alone. Strike out into the darkness.

151362.name: The Frugal Forge: 101 Magic Armor
151362.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Frugal Forge!

This document features 101 specific magic armor for your Pathfinder fantasy campaign.

Complimented with artwork from Sade and Skortched Urf Studios this document contains armor you won't find anywhere else.

Equip your hero with the Armor of Vengeance, Arrowmeld Armor, Fey Step Jacket or Webweave Armor to name just a few.

151365.name: Monster Hunter: Roar of Cards
151365.description:
User Summary

Cards will presumably play some role in the game which is described as an RPG.

151366.name: Disgaea 4: Return
151366.description:
User Summary

Disgaea 4 Return is a PS Vita port of Disgaea 4 that sees new content containing the high-leveled Peta spells along with additional characters, classes, story episodes, etc.

151367.name: Heads Up! Party Game
151367.description:
Now you can play the outrageous party game version of the popular app seen on The Ellen Degeneres Show! Slip on a headband and load it with cards. Can you guess the words you're wearing based on other players' clues? Earn chips with each correct answer. Earn the most, and you win!

Includes three popular categories from the app, plus one Exclusive Category: DYNAMIC DUOS!

Includes: 200 Cards, 6 Headbands, 48 Chips, 1-Minute Sand Timer, Instructions

151369.description:
Description
ILLEGAL is a crazy, offbeat party game for 5 to 9 players where participants each take on the role of an illegal dealer. The game is accessible to casual as well as expert gamers, and has a mature theme. The rules of ILLEGAL are simple, but the game will challenge your skills in negotiation, misdirection, discretion, charisma, and persuasion. The more you play, the more you will learn to expand and master these skills. Each game lasts about half an hour, and is packed with intense exchanges, interactions and a lot of humour.

Launch into this risqué adventure! Dare to become one of these offbeat dealers and get a good laugh with your friends.

How to Play

ILLEGAL is played in two phases:

During the first phase, each player receives a deck of cards prepared by the Game Master (GM). These decks assign each player his dealer role and gives him a good quantity of the corresponding resources. Each player's deck also specifies his buyer role, and he will make every effort during the game to get as many resources as possible of the type he is interested in. These roles are kept secret until the end of the game.

Players leave the table and split up into continually changing pairs or groups to negotiate and exchange some of their resources, away from prying eyes. Every three minutes, they return to the table to collect new resources at the docks (from the GM). Then they go again for another three minutes of secret dealing.

The second phase, called the Tribunal phase, starts once the players have returned to the table and the GM has run out of resources.

At the tribunal, players play the roles of jury members, witnesses, suspects and judges! They openly discuss their suspicions concerning the secret roles assigned to every other player. The GM reveals the suspect cards in pairs representing the dealer and buyer roles assigned to the various players. For each card pair, players have one minute to debate. After one minute, a simultaneous vote is cast, and a suspect is formally accused.

Scoring

At the end of the game, each player reveals his role pair and acquired resources. He scores one victory point for each resource acquired corresponding to his buyer role, one point for each suspect card accusing him wrongly, thus rewarding him for his skills in misdirection and discretion, but he loses 5 points for each suspect card accurately accusing him, representing 5 years spent in prison. It is very easy to end the game with a 10-year jail sentence if you are insufficiently discreet or are too greedy!
151369.name: Illegal

151370.name: Kabuki Warriors
151370.description:
From the back of the box

As a fight promoter for a troop of Kabuki warriors trying to travel from Edo to Kyoto, your actor/samurai must possess both strength and style. Along the way you will have to fight other Kabuki troops, garner the crowds favor to receive tips, and trade warriors with your defeated counterparts. You will need a very accomplished group of samurai when you arrive in Kyoto to defeat the city's star troop.

151372.description: Monopoly: Family Guy included an offer to purchase four additional pewter figures via mail order for use in the game. These characters include no rule changes, but only provide players with more choices of who to represent them during play. These additional characters are Quagmire, Joe Swanson, Evil Monkey and Ernie The Giant Chicken.
151372.name: Monopoly: Family Guy – Quagmire, Joe Swanson, Evil Monkey and Ernie The Giant Chicken

151373.description: The “Steel Curtain” has done it again! America’s favorite board game proudly presents the Pittsburgh Steelers XL Champions Collector’s Edition. Buy, sell, and trade the team’s stellar offense including Ben Roethlisberger, Hines Ward and Santonio Holmes and own their tough defense showcasing Troy Polamalu, James Harrison and Aaron Smith, in an effort to own the NFL’s best. Celebrate the Steelers’ unprecedented Super Bowl championship in this American classic, MONOPOLY!
151373.name: Monopoly: Pittsburgh Steelers Super Bowl XL Champions Collector's Edition

151375.description:
"Our bees are in danger!
In the meadow insecticides dominate. Pollution becomes unbearable.
The climate change disrupts the environment and now the Asian hornet scourge!"

In each round, you can raise or move a bee on the board. You explore the bushes to find the precious pollen. But be careful not to fall into the traps.

The game can be played with or without fighting.

You win the game by beeing the first to collect and place 3 pollen into the bottom of the beehive. The other way to win is to be the first to elimitate the most opponent bees.
151375.name: Panique dans la Ruche

151376.name: Leap Frog
151376.description:
Simple game in the 18th Blue Peter Annual. In true Blue Peter tradition, you have to make the game first.

It is a Tiddlywinks type game. Each player gets five 'frogs' and must flip them on to the board. You add scores on to the Flowers and inside the Water-Lilies. Should you be unlucky and land on a fish or into the pond, lose 10 points and 5 points respectively.

Play for as long as you like. The highest score at the end is the winner.

boardgamecompilation: Thurn and Taxis: All Roads Lead to Rome
Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory
151377.description: Repackaged Thurn and Taxis with expansions Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory and Thurn and Taxis: All Roads Lead to Rome included in the same box.
151377.name: Thurn und Taxis Big Box

boardgamepublisher: The Royal Society for the Prevention of Accidents
151378.description:
The Magic Journey is a Goose-type game, with players moving via a die roll and obeying the instructions on the illustrated spaces. Whoever reaches HOME first wins.

The Magic Journey was published in a "Tufty" book for children. Tufty games are always about avoiding accidents, and this is no exemption.
151378.name: The Magic Journey

151379.name: Danger!
151379.description:
Game featured in the British 1979 Charlie's Angels Annual.

Simple roll and move game for two players. One is the good player representing a member of Charlie's Angels I assume, and the other is the evil player, representing an Enemy Agent.

Players move according to their die roll not forgetting to obey the instructions on special squares, and the first to launch the Rescue Missile (Space 38), wins.

The rules say that the game can be played alone, by 'playing fairly' for the enemy agent's die rolls. It is the first time in a Goose-type game that I have seen a square that only applies to the Charlie's Angel player, who, if she lands on it, she is knocked out of the game. There is no such square for the Enemy Agent so he has a small advantage.

151380.description:
Game featured in the 1978 Black Beauty Annual.

A simple die rolling game. Each player is a rider in a show-jumping competition. As usual with Goose-type games, there are special spaces (illustrated by a horseshoe). Each special space represents faults earned by the rider that round. These fault points have to be written down as they are earned. A slight twist with this game is that the order of finishing also generates time-faults; 1st to finish, none; second to finish, 5 time-faults, and so on.

After all the players have finished, the player with the fewest faults, wins.
151380.name: A Clear Round?

151381.description:
A game that featured in the British 1975 Disneyland Annual.

A simple roll and move game. Players represent characters from the Disney animated film about Alice in Wonderland.

Roll a 5 to start. When you land on special square they will often tell you how many blackberries you have picked that turn. Record the number so that each player will have a total once all have finished. The player who picks the most, wins.
151381.name: Blackberry Time

boardgamecompilation: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Extreme Danger Kickstarter Bonus Pack
151382.description:
Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Explosive Objects is a promo that adds objects to the game Flash Point: Fire Rescue that can explode. The object works like the hazardous materials on steroids, takes more damage, but also makes a bigger explosion.

In this promo there are two objects, one car and flammable materials. The car can advantageously be used on the garage board, and the flammable materials on the laboratory board, but be used in any other building if desired.
151382.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Explosive Objects

151383.description:
A game that featured in the British Disneyland Annual for 1977.

A simple Goose-type game. Mickey Mouse wants to go out in his car but his friends want to go with him. He has to wait until one friend arrives (and he looks very cross as he waits by his car). Players move by a die roll and must obey the special squares. The first player to reach square 30, wins.
151383.name: Mickey Mouse's Waiting Game

151384.name: Warfighter Expansion #1: Reloading!
boardgameexpansion: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game
151384.description:
Expansion #1 for Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

This expansion includes 60 cards
- New Soldiers
- New Weapons
- New Equipment
- New Locations
- New Hostiles
- New Actions

2 Plastic Figures
4 Bullet Dice

151385.name: Warfighter Expansion #2: Stealth
boardgameexpansion: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game
151385.description:
Expansion #2 for Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game.

This expands the quiet and sneaky part of warfare.

The core game does have stealth elements, but this expansion really fills it out.

60 cards
2 Plastic Figures
4 Bullet Dice

151386.name: Warfighter Expansion #3: Support
boardgameexpansion: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game
151386.description:
Expansion #3 for Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

The Support expansion enlarges the vital role distant forces play in your mission.

This includes fire support, such as mortars, intel from UAVs, and precise fire from Snipers.

60 cards
2 Plastic Figures
4 Bullet Dice

151388.description:
Custom shaped dice to look like bullets:

One type of die is a D10 shaped as a .223 bullet.
The other type of die is a D6 in a 9mm bullet-shape

These dice are the same general size and shape as real ammunition!
boardgameaccessory: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game
151388.name: Warfighter: Bullet Dice

151389.description:
Custom made cloth "swag bag" with the Fantasy Frontier logo embroidered on.

Can be used instead of the stock draw-bag (for landscape tiles).
151389.name: Fantasy Frontier: Swag Bag

151390.description: Fantasy Frontier custom dice: Designed as a D6 with the relief of one of the airships surrounded by the name of the game above and below.
151390.name: Fantasy Frontier: Custom Dice

151391.name: Stellar War
151391.description:
Stellar War is based on an old Avalon Hill card game known as Naval War, but rather than simulate a war at sea during WWII, Stellar War simulates a war in space, in the distant future.

The object is to have the most points at the end of play, by destroying enemy spaceships and space stations and preserving your own. Each player begins with a fleet of ships and stations used to attack opponents, and plays cards from their hand that represent offensive and defensive actions and other special events. Ships and stations can acquire special defenses or abilities. Optional rules are included to allow different configurations of play.

151392.name: Hei Su Hong Su
151392.description:
Hei Su Hong Su is a battle of wits between two opponents, played on an elegantly crafted board framed in genuine cherry or mahogany. Each game includes an authentic Chinese i-ching coin. In Hei Su Hong Su, when tokens are moved off one end of the board, they return on the opposite side. Additionally, unlike other popular strategy games, players are permitted to move neutral and their opponent’s tokens as their own. Hei Su Hong Su is truly a unique and intriguing strategy game.

In Hei Su Hong Su, one player is red, other is black. At the start of the game, each player has nine pieces set up in a square in opposite corners on the board, with 18 white pieces occupying the other two corners. Players take turns “sliding” rows or columns of pieces by removing a piece from an edge and adding it to the other edge. If a player traps a piece by surrounding it with 4 of his color (including “wrapping around” to the other side of the board), it is replaced with with one of that player's pieces. If a player captures and replaces a white piece, the “tug of war” marker moves 1 in his favor on the scale. If a player captures and replaces an opponent’s piece, the marker moves 2 in his favor on the scale. The game ends when the marker has moved all the way to the end of the scale; that player is the winner.

151393.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 55 - Jul 2005)
151393.description: Issue 55 is centered on robots and robotics - fictional and real. It includes a Star Wars (d6) adventure, The Rogue Planetoid.

151395.name: Looking Glass: Mumbai
151395.description:
Publisher Blurb:

We look at India’s mightiest metropolis, from its legendary crime syndicates to its glamorous movie colony — and we look beneath it, for vampires and conspiracies and Mythos maneuverings. A “Low and Slow” city setting for many possible GUMSHOE games.

151396.description:
A quick playing card game for two where Bigfoot and the clever Cryptozoologist attempt to outwit each other! Will Bigfoot's hideaways be discovered, leaving him with nowhere to go, or will the Cryptozoologist be left frustrated?

This new game from up and coming designer Scott Almes is the ultimate battle of wits! Depending on what side you're on, you'll be playing a very different game - The Cryptozoologist is laying traps and attempting to trick the Bigfoot who must deduce and work out what's the best option...

One player plays the Cryptozoologist who is hunting for Bigfoot, played by the other player. Each round, the Cryptozoologist will lay out a series of cards in two ‘paths’, which will contain sensing equipment and special actions. Then, Bigfoot must choose which path to go on, triggering any sensing equipment and giving the Cryptozoologist a few more clues about his Lair. The Cryptozoologist wins by pinning Bigfoot in one of his Lairs, while Bigfoot wins by eluding the Cryptozoologist for six rounds. Capturing this beast won't be easy...!

By slowly eliminating the various potential lairs, the Cryptozoologist will slowly whittle down the places where Bigfoot could actually be hiding. However, if this isn't done by the end of the sixth round the beast will escape the clutches of 'science'!
151396.name: Bigfoot

151397.name: Io canto
151397.description:
Each player chooses a pawn and take the 6 pieces of its color.
Put the pawn chosen at the beginning of the board.
Shuffle the 'unexpected' and 'guests' cards in the appropriate spaces on the board.
Shuffle the 24 cards songs and arrange them in the appropriate spaces on the game board.
Insert the jury card inside the bag. If you play in 5 or 6, put them all, or, in the case of 3 or 4 players, only enter the 8 cards numbered from 1 to 2 .
The players alternate in singing receiving the votes of the public (the other players) and the judgment of the jury.
The game is played in 3 rounds plus a final.

Round 1
The current player draws the card song on top of its pile.
Read the songs and decide whether or not to accept the card, otherwise goes to the player to his left until this is chosen by someone.
If all pass, the card is given to the player who had drawn it.
The player who is assigned the card chooses one of the songs written on the front and draws an "unexpected" card.
The player performs the song choice with track on the CD and respecting the rule reported on the "unexpected".
At the end of the performance each of the other players pass a covered card of values.
The player draws a jury card.
The turn passes to the next player. In the first run you must show all at once.
At the end of the performances the players reveal their cards and advance their pawn based on the score received.

Round 2
In the second round the players are performing in duets.
The player chooses a card from the relative number of bunches . Choose a song and a player with which to perform.
The players perform together.
At the end of the performance the other players place a card deck of their color on one area related to one of the two players who have just sung.
Each of the 2-player draws a card and places the jury in your area.
As in the first run will add up your points and advancing the pawn.

Round 3
The last in the standings takes the bunch of songs for the third exhibition and chooses a card based on the type they prefer, without reading the songs.
Then draw a card guest, choose a song and a famous singer and performs alternating a normal singing voice imitation of the chosen guest.
At the end of the performance the other players place a card deck of their color on the area of ​​the board on the turn player.

Final
The two players with the highest score in the final play.
The cards not used are shuffled. Players draw a card and perform the song. The other players vote.
Players then draw a card jury.
The player with the highest score is the winner.

151398.description:
From Flying Frog's Website:

"The 'Hold the Line' Supplement is a Web-exclusive for 'Last Night on Earth' and features a new scenario and ten new game cards. All pieces are printed on the same high-quality card stock as the boardgame. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else. They feature all new artwork."
151398.name: Last Night on Earth 'Hold the Line' Supplement
boardgameexpansion: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
Last Night on Earth: Timber Peak
boardgamefamily: Last Night on Earth Game Engine

151399.name: Power Play Scenario Book
151399.description:
From the PDF:

"Scenarios are special rule sets that change the game and provide new ways for you to experience Power Play. In this supplement, we’ve collected together 9 exciting and fun ways that you can experience Power Play in a new light. We hope you enjoy them!

Note that these scenarios are designed for players that have already played the core game of Power Play several times, and are ready for new challenges and opportunities to test their wiles against their fellow Outliers.

If rules debates and questions arise during play, remember that you can use a Reality Check to resolve rules disputes in a quick and fair manner.

Have fun!"

151400.name: Cult of Life Book Two: Trial of Blood
151400.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible Adventure for 4-6 heroes level 6-8.

Designed for Tournament Play (this is round 2).

The Cult of Life has made its move. Attacking the church of Daiasuun in Shursune, they have destroyed the building and all of the clergy, taking the civilians as prisoners for their dark purposes. The only evidence the party has is that Lord Ravenbrook, who disappeared along with his city many years ago, is responsible. Why has Ravenbrook committed this atrocity? What are his plans now? Can the party find him and stop him in time?

Use character skills to explore the city of Ravenbrook, learning about the dark history and finding a way to get to the vampire lord.
Includes details of the Cult of Life, a villain group usable in any campaign
Full history of Lord Baltimius Ravenbrook, a former supporter of the crown who was corrupted by his fear of death and his desire to be with the woman he loved
Full explanations for scoring for tournament play, or compatible as either a series or single adventure
Includes a full party of pregenerated characters for use with the module or seperately. Or feel free to use your own characters and explore the city of Ravenbrook.

151401.name: Highway to Hell 2: Return to Flora
151401.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface it is no different than the world you and I live in. Most people go on about their lives never realizing the terrors that walk among them.

Despite humanity’s vast ignorance, the horrors are there. Angels, demons, gods and Hellspawn make war in the shadows. Clergy and Slayers rise from the human flock to protect their brethren and work Yahweh’s will. Magi and Witches wield powerful magics in their pursuit of enlightenment.

All these supernatural forces work in secrecy to forward their agendas. However, as the world grows smaller through technology and the factions of the war grow bolder, this secrecy becomes increasingly imperiled. Soon, the masses may learn of the existence of the gods and monsters that walk among them.

Recent events in the world of Contagion have caused things to escalate further. The Winter Solstice of 2012 saw gates open to two otherworldly realms previously isolated from Earth. The beings that came through these gates have their own agendas, and secrecy isn’t necessarily among them. The events of that fateful day also caused an unprecedented number of gates opening between Earth and Hell. These Hellgates opened in places where great tragedy, pain and acts of evil had occurred.

This story focuses on one such Hellgate, located in the rural ghost town of Flora, Illinois.

Highway to Hell 2: Return to Flora is an adventure seed for use with Contagion Second Edition. Rather than being a linear module with events that go from point A to point B, this story seed provides information a Gamemaster can use to flesh out their own unique story. Basic events are illustrated along with character snapshots. The ending is left open and ambiguous, for the Gamemaster to decide.

Highway to Hell 2: Return to Flora serves as an introductory story for Contagion Second Edition. Certain elements of the setting are explored and expanded upon in this adventure seed. Due to the nature of the disturbances and events in Highway to Hell 2: Return to Flora, characters from virtually any background or faction could get involved with the investigation. Experienced groups can also use this story seed with very minor adjustments made by the Gamemaster to account for the characters’ greater experience and resources.

Highway to Hell 2: Return to Flora also serves as a sequel to the classic Contagion adventure seed Highway to Hell. Highway to Hell 2: Return to Flora also includes conversion info to make the original Highway to Hell playable using Contagion Second Edition rules.

151402.name: Contagion Second Edition
151402.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface it is no different than the world you and I live in. Most people go on about their lives never realizing the terrors that walk among them.

Despite humanity’s vast ignorance, the horrors are there. Angels demons, gods and Hellspawn make war in the shadows. Clergy and Slayers rise from the human flock to protect their brethren and work God's will. Magi and Witches wield powerful magics in their pursuit of enlightenment.

There's a war in the shadows. Choose a side.

Contagion Second Edition utilizes a highly modified version of the 3.5 OGL. Contagion Second Edition provides a self-contained game system, unique in approach and design. The updated, streamlined system is familiar enough that seasoned OGL players and Gamemasters should be able to jump right in, while being simple enough for even novice gamers to quickly grasp.

The Contagion Second Edition corebook updates the Contagion game setting, with expanded information on the history of the setting, exposing the secrets of the universe and opening the setting up to entirely new worlds and worldviews.

New rules include an improved combat system, an all new take on magic, magic items and metamagic feats, the elimination of levels and introduction of a points-based character creation and advancement system, the inclusion of Contagion Points, which allow the characters greater flexibility and resilience when facing the terrors of the night and serve as a central narrative force within the game.

Contagion Second Edition offers 20 playable races, 35 Callings, new feats, festures Occupations and Traits enabling players to create unique, customized characters with which to explore the world of Contagion.

151403.name: Things That Should Not Be
151403.description:
From publisher blurb:

Glimpse the Beyond is a Role-Playing Game in which players assume the roles of Magi, rare individuals who study the arcane arts in an attempt to understand and possibly control that which Should Not Be.

Things That Should Not Be focuses on the supernatural creatures that inhabit the world of Glimpse the Beyond. This book contains ten monsters for use in your Glimpse the Beyond campaign as well as expanded rules including additional Supernatural Boons, Flaws and SFX.

Things That Should Not Be includes:

Anchimayen: spirits of flame that can inhabit the corpses of children.
Court of the Yellow Ribbon Cultist: worshippers of the King in Yellow, who place their lives at the mercy of their mad master.
Grassman: hulking, hairy primates that creep in the woodlands of North America.
Jersey Devil: a cryptid that curses its victims by laying bare their greatest fears.
The King in Yellow: an avatar of madness that feeds on the insanity of his victims.
The Masque of the Red Death: the living embodiment of pestilence & disease.
Sasquatch: Twisted ghosts of Grassmen that aggressively defend their haunts.
Thing from Beyond: an organic mimic that copies the traits of organisms it encounters, lying in wait for the appropriate time to attack…and consume.
This Man: A terrifying and enigmatic creature who appears to various people across the globe in their dreams.
Willows: invisible creatures that infect natural areas with an aura of dread and madness.

151404.name: Secret Societies
151404.description:
From publisher blurb:

Glimpse the Beyond is a Role-Playing Game in which players assume the roles of Magi, rare individuals who study the arcane arts in an attempt to understand and possibly control that which Should Not Be.

Secret Societies focuses on the magickal organizations active in the world of Glimpse the Beyond This book contains information on the Affiliation boon and includes five sample societies for use in your Glimpse the Beyond campaign as well as expanded rules including new equipment, special abilities and animal traits.

Secret Societies includes:

The Hermetic Order: an arcane society studying alchemy, sacred geometry and high ritual. Members gain access to vast libraries and alchemical knowledge.
Miskatonic Honors Academy: Scholars of the paranormal, the MHA uses parapsychology techniques, esoteric equipment and peer review to study the realms of the supernatural. Members can resist Terror attacks and gain access to unusual technologies.
Sigillum DEI: studants of Enochian magicks who believe that through language they can unlock the keys to the universe. Members gain faith that protects them from Madness and access to Divine Power, using language to boost their magick.
The Crossroads Jam Session: a group of loosley associated practitioners who come together as needed for the common good. Members gain the benefit of the Community Spirit and the blessing of Legba the loa.
Scholars of Avalon: an order of shapeshifters and spies dedicated to preserving and expanding the British Empire. Members gain Shapeshifting and Alternate Identities.

151405.name: Rugby Aotearoa
151405.description:
A basic memory-style game with a NZ rugby theme. Collect pairs of cards to score points, play a tackle token to prevent a player from collecting a set.

Released to coincide with the [2013?] Rugby World Cup.

(n.b.: Aotearoa is the Maori name for New Zealand)

151406.name: Myriad: Special Extended Edition
151406.description:
From publisher blurb:

This special extended edition of the Myriad system is available only in printed format, and contains a huge amount of additional bonus material from the brand new rules for using stealth as a form of conflict to the mass battle rules, not to mention a large selection of new SFX and an additional chapter on designing your own game setting. No budding Myriad System author should be without it!

151407.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Bring your lieutenants to life with Lieutenant Packs for Descent: Journeys in the Dark Second Edition! The Rylan Olliven Lieutenant Pack introduces a sculpted figure and personalized Plot deck for the corrupt politician from the Shadow of Nerekhall expansion. Use the Ryland Olliven figure to replace his lieutenant token, or use his Plot deck to undermine the heroes in any campaign with false informants and double agents. Both overlord and heroes gain new options for strategic play through the threat and fortune tokens included in this Lieutenant Pack.
151407.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Rylan Olliven Lieutenant Pack
boardgameexpansion: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)

151408.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Verminous Lieutenant Pack
boardgameexpansion: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
151408.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Bring your lieutenants to life with Lieutenant Packs for Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)! The Rat-Thing King from Shadow of Nerekhall schemes in the darkness, waiting for the perfect moment to strike. The Verminous Lieutenant Pack includes a sculpted figure as well as a personalized Plot deck. The overlord can now bring Verminous into other campaigns, using his minions to attack from the shadows. Both overlord and heroes gain new options with the threat and fortune tokens in this Lieutenant Pack.

151409.description:
Bedlam is a humorous card game with some other components, set in an asylum world full of the lunatics from everywhere else in the multiverse.

The aim of Bedlam is to accumulate Heart and Mind points, or be the last player left standing. If a player loses all their Heart points, they are Scared to Death. If they lose all their Mind points, they have Gone Crazy. In either case, they are out of the game.

On a typical turn a player will face an Enemy or Ordeal, and try to beat it using a Slider with inverse stat values to make their Courage and Sanity greater than what they are facing. Beating Enemies and Ordeals earns Reward cards as well as points.

During turns players can place one of each type of Stuff card on the table in front of them. Stuff cards are Weapons, Buddies or Things. Stuff can help its owner, or be used to mess with opponents.
151409.name: Bedlam Cards

151410.description:
The first game in the Cross Hares line — each of which will be standalone with its own expansions — is Cross Hares: Testing Ground, a fairly straightforward game in which you want to move down a trail from your starting area in order to "defeat" a factory at the end of the line.

To start, each player chooses one of the six available characters. As you move down the trail, you'll draw cards, which might be good or bad for you, bad for opponents, or terrible for everyone at the table. You'll also acquire useful items and specialties — with each character having a different set of things to find — have adventures, and come into conflict with other players. Conflict in Cross Hares takes the form of either shoving each other back and forth around the map or stealing items.

Don't worry if you're far back on the path away from everyone else as with the right events or die rolls, you can race ahead of the others! Once you get to the factory, though, you'll need all of your skills and items to defeat it, so be sure you save some of your strength for that.
151410.name: Cross Hares: Testing Ground
boardgameexpansion: Cross Hares: Testing Ground – Kickstarter Custom Character Expansion Pack

151411.description:
Game featured in the 1976 Rupert Annual.

It is a simple roll and move game. Each player chooses a colour and will need 6 counters of that colour. Only one counter for each player will be in play at any time.

Players throw a die to move their way along a 50-space track. If a player lands on one of the six illustrated spaces, they must put their counter on the correct spot for that character. These spots are marked around the illustration in the centre of the board. That player then takes another counter of her colour and starts at square 1 again. Only one of her counters can be on any spot. The first player to have her 6 counters on the spots in the centre, wins.
151411.name: Rupert's School-Time Game

151412.description:
Game featured in the 1978 British Disneyland Annual. Various Disney characters are illustrated on the board.

This is a Goose-type game. Players move by throw of a die and must follow instructions should they land on one. The first player to reach square 64 by exact throw, wins the game and can enjoy a cup of tea with the Mad Hatter himself.
151412.name: An Invitation to the Mad Hatter's Tea-Party

rpg: Becoming: A Game of Heroism and Sacrifice
151413.name: Becoming: A Game of Heroism and Sacrifice
151413.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"Becoming is a game about heroism and sacrifice. It’s about what it takes to be a hero, what you have to give up in order to save the people important to you, and the home you have to leave behind. It’s about making hard choices in the face of relentless adversity, and it’s about giving up pieces of yourself in order to make sure you succeed.

In Becoming, one player takes on the role of the Hero: an individual marked by destiny or the will of the people or some other form of greatness, sent out into the world to do dangerous things in order to save people.

The other players take on the roles of the Fates: intangible, conceptual forces of malice and adversity, bent on taking everything from the Hero, maybe even making her become a villain.

The Hero goes on a Quest, and the Fates provide obstacles and conflict, as well hard bargains that the Hero must sometimes accept in order to push on. Sometimes those bargains cost her a lot, but what they cost her is usually more palatable than what she’ll lose if she falters."

151415.name: Tauwetter
151415.description:
translated from the back of the book

By chance the heroes meet an old friend again, who really should not be in Paavi. He entangles them into his political plans, which ultimately will lead to overthrow of the duchess. But before that, Paavi must be defended against a danger no one expected, and the heroes have to face a former ally who now goes very own ways. It is also important for them to redeem a promise to meet a seemingly all-powerful adversary.

Ultimately, much blood will stain the Brydia red, until in the end of 1038 BF nothing in Paavi is as it was.

151416.description:
The graphic design and advertising industry is a fast-paced and competitive place, as any creative or developer can tell you. Creative Clash is a humorous card game that pokes fun at the industry. Players take on the role of owner of their own creative agency. They hire employees, compete to complete projects and buy lots of cool stuff in order to reach their ego goal. The first player to reach their ego goal is the winner. Players have plenty of opportunity to sabotage each other with an assortment of event cards.

It's a quick and casual light card game that typically plays in half an hour.
151416.name: Creative Clash
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 84 - If You Like Munchkin, Try...

151417.name: Tactical Intervention
151417.description:
Tactical Intervention (TI) is a new FPS game using the latest Source engine (developed by world renowned software developer, Valve)


TI features some of the most famous Counter-Terrorist units from around the world fighting against fictional terrorist factions.
Game play is designed to be accessible to new players while still retaining a deep structure allowing players to grow and develop their skills encouraging team play.
TI has a growing arsenal of firearms based on real life weaponry. Modeled accurately, these weapons can also be customized with various accessories that alter their functionality.
Levels in TI are based on urban environments that challenge players to play in a much more tactical mindset.
New elements such as dogs and vehicles that players can interact with provide a whole new challenge for players to master.
NPC elements such as civilians and cars, add a sense of randomness to the battle as they can play a vital role in the success of a mission. They can also be used to gain an advantage over the opposing team.


Source: The Publisher Website.

151418.name: No Security: Horror Scenarios in the Great Depression
151418.description:
From publisher blurb:

The crops fail. Then the banks fall, crushing every honest man on the ledgers beneath their rubble. The fertile lands turn to dust, the modern marvels into slums. Spirits are the last to go, but in the end they break like everything else.

America becomes a curse. Hope – a memory. Some whisper about revolution. Others talk of Armageddon.

But for the unluckiest few, they are coming, drawn from other realities to feast off the misery. And those poor souls will learn the true meaning of “Great Depression.”

No Security presents five original tales of terror compatible with multiple pen-and-paper RPG systems. The various settings within 1930’s America – ranging from the ravaged farmlands of rural Georgia to the icy peak of Mount McKinely – put players in desperate situations from the very start. The cast of original, Lovecraftian creatures frees experienced gamers from the complacency brought on by years spent memorizing the monstrosities of their favorite system. Bring the “horror” back to gaming and your players to the edge of their seats.

The real hard times approach. Do you have what it takes to survive?

151419.name: NoGo
151419.description:
Introduction

NoGo is a combinatorial game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square or rectangular board. Board sizes bigger than 9x9 are not recommended. 6x7 boards have been used in some human matches.

NoGo takes the Go concepts of group and liberty and uses them in the most minimalistic possible way. The resulting game, with no captures, no cycles and no scoring, is no rival for Go, but remains a fertile ground for tactical challenges in the Dots and Boxes style.

This game seems to have been first mentioned by someone called John Moore at Sensei's Library, in April 1, 2005.


Definitions

A group is a set of orthogonally adjacent, like-colored stones.

A liberty of a group is an empty point orthogonally adjacent to that group.


Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On his turn, a player must place a stone of his color on an empty point of the board. At the end of a turn, all groups on the board (both friendly and enemy) must have at least one liberty. Otherwise the player's move is illegal. Whoever can't make a move on his turn loses.

151421.name: Game of Tones
151421.description:
Game of Tones is a set of fourteen different music games designed to play with tonalities, chords, measures, key signatures, notes on the pentagram and even the location of the notes on a guitar neck. These multiple games can be played at different levels, depending on the musical knowledge of the players. The deck consists of 52 cards representing musical notes and rhythmic figures, with the help of the Circles of Fifths printed on each card, and with different suits or colors, together with some special wildcards.

It consists of many different games, featuring different game mechanics and goals: getting more points or cards than your opponents, be the first to run out of cards, move cards to certain places on the table, etc. In every game there are two different “levels” to keep track: the Musical Level and the Strategy Level, and both are independent from each other. The Strategy Level depends on the particular game, while the Musical Level can be adjusted in most of the games. Some of the games are up to 10 players, others are solitary type ones, for 2 players, and even some of the games can be played in teams or cooperatively.

Pawns are used in some of the games, and Game of Tones also includes two additional board games.
