These games are called Pianogram, in which the board represents a G-clef staff or a piano, depending on the orientation in which it is placed; and Fretboard, in which the board represents a guitar (or any other stringed instrument) neck.

Designed from an educational standpoint, Game of Tones includes a list of the musical concepts used in every game, and a teaching guide for music teachers. Game of Tones is not language dependent, except for the instructions, which are available in English and Spanish.

151422.description:
Otters is a quick, kid-friendly card game for 2-4 players ages 6 and up. Players take turns sending otters from their hand to the lake playgrounds on the board, playing 2 cards per turn. If you add enough otters to a playground to fill it up, you win that playground! Whoever has the most valuable collection of playgrounds at the end of the game is the winner.

Most of the game is made up of simple otters numbered 1, 2 or 3. Players must decide which 2 of their cards in hand to play, and which playgrounds to play them to.

There are also special otters in the deck, which players can use to try to win playgrounds quickly, plus alligator cards to keep opponents away from playgrounds.

The playgrounds themselves range in value from 2 to 10, making some easy to win with a card or two, but less valuable to your final score. Others are hard to win but worth lots of points! And if you collect all three playgrounds of the same color, you get bonus points at the end of the game.

Otters is simple enough for kids to play, helping them to learn basic addition. But it's also designed to be interesting for adults, requiring strategic decision making.

Ultimately, Otters is a game about playing with adorable otters with your friends and family.
151422.name: Otters

151423.name: Hostile Waters: Antaeus Rising
151423.description:
User Summary

A real-time strategy/third-person shooter hybrid in which the player equips a vehicle fleet with personality chips and sends them on missions, and fight on the frontlines by taking direct control of one of the available vehicles. Includes voice-overs by Tom Baker (of Doctor Who fame).

The back of the box says:

"The year is 2032. Twenty years have passed since the Great Wars ended. Somewhere in the depths of the Pacific ocean, a dark cabal prepares for battle. Your only option is to relearn war. Revive the last of the adaptive cruisers. Fuse its systems with the chip contained minds of dead soldiers. Only then will you have the ability to lend battle vehicles autonomous control. Only then will you have the power to take on the might of the cabal.

These are Hostile Waters..."

151424.name: Stamp Albums
151424.description:
A Decktet Game for 2-players in which you try to buy as many "stamps" as possible for your album in competition with the other player.
Each player has their own shop and a market place runs down the centre of the table. Players may purchase from any row using the cards in their hand.
For the time being rules etc. can be viewed at http://wiki.decktet.com/game:stamp-albums

151425.name: Lava Cap
151425.description:
User Summary

Lava Cap is a puzzle game in which the player has a set amount of time to place channels on a grid in hopes of creating the longest path possible for the lava to flow from the starting volcano. Once the time is up, the lava flows along the shortest path created, adding points to the player's score as it travels. Channels that have not been connected are a points penalty, and a set number of points is required to advance to the next level.

151426.name: Make the King
151426.description:
From the publisher:

Make The King is a small RPG about three characters trying to become King, while the old King Keeton is dying: the King’s rightful heir, the supreme general, and the King’s bastard son.

They will take turns in trying to gain the King’s favor, but they also must take care of the Kingdom, under attack from an invading army.

151427.name: Agents of Spectrum
151427.description:
From the PocketMod back cover:

There is a secret world behind the real. A world of the Great Game -- filled with covert agents, double-crosses, and attacks against humanity.

You and your friends prevent this from spilling over to the real world. Not as suave, highly-trained agents, but as their handlers.

SPECTRUM is looking for a new Control. Will you prove your agents superior to the others? Become the next Controller for the Agents of SPECTRUM

151428.name: House of Unusual Size
151428.description:
From the publisher:

The PCs wake with no memories and find themselves trapped in Keeton Manor – a mysterious mansion of infinite size. They must struggle to discover their own identities and the nature of their relationship to the haunted Keeton family while desperately seeking a way to escape to house.

The House of Unusual Size uses a round-robin GM system, which alternates GM and player duties during each scene and gives the group a chance to experiment with genres and narrative styles during each session.

151429.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Tristayne Olliven Lieutenant Pack
boardgameexpansion: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
151429.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Bring your lieutenants to life with Lieutenant Packs for Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)! Necromantic magic explodes out of the Shadow of Nerekhall expansion with the Tristayne Olliven Lieutenant Pack. This expansion includes a detailed figure and a personalized Plot deck that highlights Tristayne's chaotic energy. With his Plot deck, the overlord can also introduce Tristayne into other campaigns, using his dark powers to ruin the heroes. Both overlord and heroes gain new options with the threat and fortune tokens in this Lieutenant Pack.

151430.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Bring your lieutenants to life with Lieutenant Packs for Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)! With the Mirklace Lieutenant Pack, the overlord can unleash the full power of the demon mage from the Shadow of Nerekhall expansion. This Lieutenant Pack includes a detailed figure and a personalized Plot deck that highlights Mirklace's scorching presence. The Plot deck also allows the overlord to summon Mirklace into other campaigns and use his evil magic to annihilate the heroes. Both overlord and heroes gain new options with the threat and fortune tokens in this Lieutenant Pack.
151430.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Gargan Mirklace Lieutenant Pack
boardgameexpansion: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)

151431.name: Daring Adventures
151431.description:
From the publisher:
Daring Adventures offers quick, no-prep superhero roleplaying, roughly in the style of golden age comics. It’s for the 2013 24 Hour RPG contest, so it’s in pocketmod form and uses no numbers. You’ll need a deck of cards and some tokens to play, plus good eyes and enough patience to read through once before play; the organization was pretty much dictated by the space constraints, so it’s not written to my usual standard of clarity.

151433.description:
Wolf The Game is a social party game around deception, deduction and perception. Based on the traditional games of Mafia and Werewolf, Wolf offers a balanced and multifaceted approach to this beloved category.

Players take on the roles of villagers, trying to cope with an influx of murderous werewolves. Some players will be villagers and must try and work out which other players are secretly werewolves before the wolves kill everyone!

With 11 different roles available in the base game, Wolf offers small to large groups a great way to get to know each other and having some quality lynching time together.
151433.name: Wolf The Game

151434.name: Shadow Journal #1: The Burning Crow
151434.description:
From publisher blurb:

***Note: The Burning Crow first appeared in Savage Insider Premium Issue #2 and is now presented as a standalone offering. No changes have been made other than for layout purposes.***

Deep within the norther highlands of Wisconsin prowls the Burning Crow cult. Dedicated to the proliferation of supernatural beasts, they are said to be the creators of new species. One often wonders how so many were-creatures are able to exist and the Burning Crow is just one explanation.

The Burning Crow represents a modern cult within Shadowed Earth. The Burning Crow cult dedicates their lives to the protection of Earth's flora and fauna through the use of old Celtic lycanthropy rituals that imbues their bodies with the essence of a native creature.

The Burning Crow includes:

A brief look at the history of the Burning Crow cult.
Descriptions and stat blocks of its members.
Adventure hooks.
... and more!




Shadow Journal #1: The Burning Crow is not a standalone game and requires the Savage Worlds core rulebook. Although designed to be used in conjunction with any modern Shadowed Earth core setting guide, such as Judgment Day, the source material can be used with any Savage Worlds product.

The Shadow Journal series presents supplemental material and adventures for one or more of Mystical Throne Entertainment's Shadowed Earth settings.

151435.name: Shadow Journal #2: Of Orchids and Oaths
151435.description:
From publisher blurb:

**Note: Of Orchids and Oaths first appeared in Savage Insider Premium Issue #3 and is now presented as a standalone offering. No changes have been made other than for layout purposes.***

A rash of missing person’s cases has drawn the attention of Armen Potestas. Armen is the leader of the Fera Venator (the Huntsmen), a secret society sworn to protect humanity from any and all evil that threatens it. After looking into the most recent case, Armen believes that a vampire threatens the city.

Of Orchids and Oaths presents a 1930s Seasoned adventure for Shadowed Earth. The PCs investigation leads them into Chicago where there is much more going on than what lurks on the surface. The deeper the PCs investigate, the more weirdness they uncover.

Of Orchids and Oaths includes:

A standalone adventure module for modern Shadowed Earth settings.
Additional encounters to scale or extend the adventure.
A look into the forces behind the incidents.




Shadow Journal #2: Of Orchids and Oaths is not a standalone game and requires the Savage Worlds core rulebook. Although designed to be used in conjunction with any modern Shadowed Earth core setting guide, such as Judgment Day, the source material can be used with any Savage Worlds product.

151437.name: Shadowed Earth Core Setting Guide
151437.description:
From publisher blurb:

“History is a lie. Many men have said that history is written by those who achieve victory. The truth is that history is written by those who want to hide the truth from the fragile minds of humanity. Why, you may ask? If humanity knew the truth about the world around them, it would truly drive them insane. The mind of the average citizen cannot fathom the powers that lie just beyond their reach; nor do they possess the willpower to steel their minds from the horrors that surround us every day.”

- Grand Inquisitor Black Steel

Few understand what lurks within the shadows. Their knowledge, however, is key to humanity’s survival. For thousands of years, humanity has been fighting a battle with the occult and the horrors from the Chaos Realm and other Mortal Realms. Sometimes they win, sometimes they lose, but the war never seems to end. As time moves on, humanity became stronger, able to stand against those wishing to enslave or kill them. However, to do this, almost everyone would have to think these horrors do not exist. It is the books of history that reflect this change from knowing to disbelieving.

Shadowed Earth is a fantasy horror alternate history setting that spans all time. It takes the folklore, mythology, and legends of old and makes them real. It then combines those with elements of horror to make it more dangerous. This is the core setting guide, establishing the framework and canon that makes-up all of Shadowed Earth. It is written as an all-encompassing setting for Mystical Throne Entertainment’s various RPG settings and fictional offerings and is presented with no particular system in mind. You can use this book to expand your Shadowed Earth games, create your own Shadowed Earth settings, or plug-in various modules, placing them in the alternate history of Shadowed Earth (such as the Ultimate Roman Legions Guide and Ultimate Three Kingdoms Guide).

The Shadowed Earth core setting guide includes:

A narrative retelling of all major historical events within the Shadowed Earth alternate history.
A journey from Prehistory to the New Age, defining the major movements of the Occult and the Inquisition.
An introduction to the major organizations: Inquisition, The Fallen, Illuminati, and the Occult.
A small GM’s Guide for how Game Masters can incorporate Shadowed Earth into their games.




The truth may be more dangerous than the lie…

151439.name: Hydlide II: Shine of Darkness
151439.description:
The game introduced a morality meter, where the player can be aligned with Justice, Normal, or Evil. Killing humans or good monsters lowers the player's morality, while fighting evil monsters increases it. If the player has an evil alignment, the townsfolk will ignore the player, denying access to certain clues, dialogues, equipment, and training. The game also introduced a time option, allowing the player to speed up or slow down the gameplay.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hydlide," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

151440.name: Hydlide 3: The Space Memories
151440.description:
Many years after the events of Hydlide II, an explosion of flames appeared near The City of the Woods. After that, enemies were everywhere. A young man is chosen to find the source of the evil.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hydlide 3," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

151441.name: Fierce fight! Leningrad Blitzkrieg
151441.description:
This is a fifth game of the Struggle of Army group Manstein series.

The game starts June 22 and ends September 10 in 1941.
The map covers from Konigsberg to Leningrad.
The game uses the same engine as its predecessor. Each player selects his chits each turn, then draw chits one by one and activate part of the force designated by the chit.
The victory is measured by VPs and mainly got from the control of major city hexes.

151444.name: Volgarr the Viking
151444.description:
Return to the Golden Age of arcades with an all-NEW hardcore action experience that pulls no punches. Volgarr the Viking possesses all the hallmarks of the true classics - simple controls, high challenge, and meticulous design - combined with hand-made pixel animation, an epic soundtrack, and buckets of blood. Flex your gaming muscles and step into the arena with Volgarr the Viking. We dare you.

Source: The Developer Website.

151445.name: Double Dragon II: Wander of the Dragons
151445.description:
Double Dragon II: Wander of the Dragons is an 3D enhanced remake of Double Dragon II: The Revenge.

Source: Wikipedia, "Double Dragon II: The Revenge," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

151446.description:
After dying in a fireworks exhibition due to lack of security, a young Fallera -a girl dressed in traditional valencian costume- comes to life as a zombie. She feels furious and wants revenge. Therefore, she awakens dozens of traditional valencian characters, now turned into zombies. There is only one solution to save humanity from the apocalypse: to find five ingredients to cook a tasty paella that calms the rage of the fallera.

A unique game based on a 100 cards deck. Players (2 to 5) must find 5 ingredient cards to win the game. Ingredients, as well as other kind of treasures, can be stolen by other players. They can use battle cards to fight and achieve other's possessions, comparing attack and defense points of the two cards in the battle. Bluffing is also a must, as the player who is attacked can't see the character who is using his opponent. The game has some luck component and players can use very different kind of special cards not only to strengthen their soldiers, but to fiercely punish their competitors.
151446.name: La Fallera Calavera: el joc de cartes valencià
boardgameexpansion: La Fallera Calavera 2: els ingredients de la discòrdia
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ33: De birres i paella pel Vell Món

151447.description:
"VW Fahrschule. Ein geschicklichkeitsspiel fur junge und alte Autofahrer". Eng. - Volkswagen Driving school. A skill game for young and old car drivers". This game was published in 1950s.

Players roll the dice and move cars on the board along the separate from each other route (four different colors: red, blue, green and black as a VW Beetle car tokens too).

To win, you need to cross seven stations. Players begin from different sides of the board and end at parking (driving school).

Doubles change the traffic light (placed on the board) from red to green (or vice versa). Players cannot move through red lights, until they roll doubles again.
151447.name: VW Fahrschule

151448.description:
Travel to the mystic realm of Gensokyo, a place where humans and youkai live together sealed off from the outside world. Gensokyo is not always peaceful, though, and conflicts and alliances arise constantly. To resolve these incidents, the Spell Card system was created, allowing humans and youkai alike to compete in beautiful and elegant danmaku battles. Who will be victorious? Take to the skies and shoot it out!

Danmaku!! is a card game for 4 – 7 players based off of the Touhou series of shoot-’em-up games. Players choose one of the dozens of characters in the Touhou universe and secretly take the roles of the Heroine, the Partners, Bosses, and the EX Boss. Attack your enemies and defend your allies by playing cards to shoot each other, graze others’ attacks, or activate your Spell Card to create powerful, unique effects.
151448.name: Danmaku!!

151449.description:
The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the center section. Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns to the center space.

Components: 8 red, 8 yellow, 8 pink, and 8 blue wood pieces, indicator and black Father Goose figure made of wood.
151449.name: Old Father Goose

151450.description:
Bull Moose is a U. S. presidential election game based on the 1912 election. The split in the Republican party resulted in Teddy Roosevelt launching the Progressive Party. Concurrently the Socialists under Eugene Debs had their best showing to date. The Prohibitionists fielded Eugene Chaffin running only seven years prior to the passing of the 18th Amendment (prohibition). This resulted in a five-way race in which the Democrats actually won and the third party, the Progressives came in second.

The election is represented by a straightforward, card driven, geographically based game where the winners of each state are decided by lot. The winning of the election and victory condition criteria is loosely based on the popular vote and not on how the electoral college actually functions.
151450.name: Bull Moose

151451.name: Know It All
151451.description:
A trivia card game where players or teams compete to give as many correct answers as possible to a question posed from one of 80 cards.

Example categories include: naming Santa's reindeer, naming signs of the zodiac, or naming the countries which border Germany.

Players score points for each correct answer and the team or person with the most points, wins.

151452.name: Panzar
151452.description:
Panzar is a third-person action game in the spirit of modern competitive multiplayer games. The emphasis is on team-based play. Since it features character growth and experience-based leveling, Panzar is frequently mistaken for an MMORPG. However, we consider Panzar to be an MMO/action game with role-playing elements.

Players will find themselves in a world of swords and sorcery - a whirlwind of intense melee combat and devious spell-casting. The four races at war are the Dwarves, Orcs, Elves, and Humans. The gorgeous landscapes on which their battles are fought will immerse you in a world of fantasy and wonder.

Source: The Game Website.

151453.name: Kyoto
151453.description:
This game was created by Reiner Knizia to commemorate the 20th anniversary of Mobius Games.

On a player's turn, they place one tile to score. Each tile draws three or four of the four elements (the pond, moss, colored leaves, gravel). If a placed tile is connected to an already placed tile by the same elements, the player gets that score. Because it scores in each element, it is possible that the player will get the score of multiple elements at the same time.

In addition, each player has an element to get bonus points. Score of this element is obtained twice.

151454.name: Engage: Spaceship Combat
151454.description:
Engage: Spaceship Combat is a miniature wargame that allows players to control and battle one or more starships.

Players alternate in choosing one of their ships and completing three actions with it; these actions can be to attack with various weapon systems, move, repair, transfer power etc.

Each ship has its own small play card showing its key systems; to which damage and extra power tokens are added making it easy for the players to see what condition and power level the ship's various systems are currently at.

The game has several pre-set missions with victory conditions allowing players to win a Combat Victory (destroying more of the enemy fleet than their own) and/or Objective Victory (completing the mission objectives).

151455.description:
The goal is to be the first to get from the starting point in Garmisch-Partenkirchen to one of the 5 northern spaces at the top of the board. Moves are determined by the spinner on the upper left side of the board. The spinner shows numbers between 1 and 6 as well as the four directions (N, E, S, W).

Released in the '50s. A later Edition was called Kreuz und quer durch Deutsche Lande, probably in the '60s.
151455.name: Kreuz und quer durch West: und Mitteldeutschland

151456.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Duel Pack 1
151456.description:
Experience again the intensity of Krosmaster Arena battles, with two brand new heroes in a fast, fun and strategic duel!

Each duel pack comes with 2 exclusive figures, CAPTAIN AMAKNA and MERKATOR, and their character cards as well as:

1 game map
2 token sheets
2 engraved dice




This is a standalone 2 player game that can also be used to expand Krosmaster: Arena.

Integrates with:

Krosmaster: Arena

151460.description: This is a golf game, moving around a board, trying to do it in as few moves as possible, per hole, just like in golf. As per the box "An indoor game for the family. No knowledge of golf is required. Any golf course score card may be used". The game has cards which are used as the stroke and putting of the game. There are also score cards, and each hole is played as you would play a real golf hole. There is a board, 90 stroke cards, 30 penalty cards, 30 putt cards and 4 move markers.
151460.name: Cadi Golf

151461.name: Expedition: Famous Explorers – Travel Tickets and Hazard Cards
151461.description:
A deck of Travel Tickets and Hazard Cards was included with all Kickstarter copies of Expedition: Famous Explorers.

5 Hazard Cards - On a player's turn he may spend a ticket to have another player draw one. The drawn card goes either face up or face down in front of the player who drew it (depending on what is drawn). Players may only force a player to draw one hazard card per game. The card will most likely hinder the player in a limited way, usually for one turn, but there will be one card that gives the player a benefit. Using this deck is optional. Players may use the advanced rules to add more ways to spend tickets. Players then become more careful about how they spend tickets.

30 Travel Tickets - The base game will have tokens.

In addition, miniatures were part of the Kickstarter exclusive content. They are listed separately as a board game accessory.

151462.name: Mijnlieff
151462.description:
Mijnlieff is a timeless strategy game that'll have you playing in seconds! Play against your Facebook or Game Center friends, challenge the built-in viking opponents, or even auto-match with a mystery player from around the world!

Source: The Developer Website.

151463.name: UNSanctioned: The Dream Corrupted
151463.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It's 2003. But not the 2003 you remember. The bright shining dream of the world has been sold out in exchange for alleged security and global unity. The government of the United States has used its "big stick" in diplomacy for so long that they all but own the planet. Of course, they don't admit it. But its been patently obvious for years who controls the UN and why... In this same world, beings with amazing powers began to appear in the late 1940s. Since then they've become a part of our everyday lives. But the UN exerts controls on those beings. If you have metahuman abilities, you must be sanctioned by the UN to use them. If not, you are...UNSANCTIONED! The world is not what it could be. Players take the role of unsanctioned metahumans in a world dominated by the UN. Can they stand idly by while the Peacekeepers, led by the powerful Peacemaker, continue their campaign of oppression? Or will they stand up and be counted alongside the Unsanctioned Rebels, led by the Hero of the People, as they fight for truth, justice, and the right to determine your own destiny? You must decide! Complete game in one book, includes the Paradigm Shift system, lots of sample characters (good & evil) and a mini-campaign. More than 160 pages!

151464.description:
Your casino empire is expanding, but new players want a piece of your action. There's only one direction to go to stay ahead of your competition — up! Lords of Vegas: UP! allows for up to six players to compete in Lords of Vegas.

What's more, you'll now be able to increase the size of your casinos not just by building out, but also by building up. These new, taller hotels are more prestigious, and as a result earn you more victory points.
151464.name: Lords of Vegas: UP!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 11: The Lone Shark
OBG 130: Back In Box
The Game Pit - Episode 29: The Expanded Expansion Special

151465.description:
A Kickstarter and convention promo card for the base game.

Once advanced, this card provides a one-use technology effect that allows you to search through the technology draw pile for one card of your choice instead of taking a normal draw action, When used in a conflict, it provides no power but instead allows you to immediately return your inactive cards to your hand.
151465.name: Hegemonic Promo Card: Dimensional Anomaly

151466.description:
A Kickstarter and convention promotional card for the base game.

Once advanced, this card provides a one-use technology that allows you to discard all the tiles in the sector pool and refill the pool with new tiles from the stack. When used in conflicts, Cosmic Engineering results in the power from played technology being ignored, but the card must be discarded after use.
151466.name: Hegemonic Promo Card: Cosmic Engineering

151467.name: Il était une forêt
151467.description:
This game will give you the power to become the architect of a primary forest.

To win the game, you need to be the best strategist: your forest need to be the biggest and the least degraded by the Man.
In particular, don't forget that fauna and flora need to remain in balance ...
[based on the editor description]

In concrete terms, you build complete trees, composed of 4 layers (roots in the soil, 2 levels of trunk, and the crown). Each layer can host only a limited number of animals. For example, with 4 trees, you try to have exactly 4 individuals of each species.
[based on description on Ludigaume site]

151468.description:
The fast moving game that transports you in to the world of Downton Abbey. As a maid or footman, you have to complete the tasks you are given as quickly as possible. Starting in the Servants' Hall, each player is dealt Destination cards which have varying values indicated by the number of bells on the card. This relates to how important or difficult the task is. The players must then navigate their way around the corridors and stairs of the Abbey, throwing the dice to determine how many moves they can make.

Once they reach the destination of a task, they collect their bell tokens, and the next player throws the dice to set off for the next job. But nothing is that simple! Along the way, a player can land on a 'Carson Card' space and have to take a card, which could either help or hinder them. On other spaces, the player may have to collect a 'Letter' which could call them away from the Abbey, slowing them down or costing them bells! And which route will they take? A short easy looking one to get a job done earning only one bell, or a longer route with the possibility of collecting a higher reward?

The winner is the player who has completed all their jobs and collected the most bells.
151468.name: Downton Abbey: The Board Game

151469.name: Shine
151469.description:
Theme - Shine is a biblically based deck building game. In Shine, you are a person who has recently become a Christian. Though saved and forgiven, you still struggle with sin. Your goal is to remove sin from your life and grow in spiritual maturity. To do this, you will spend time in God’s word, prayer, and use your spiritual gifts to minister to the lost and the hurting. It is not as easy as it seems. Satan prowls like a roaring lion. You will face various temptations, but through it all, God will never leave you or forsake you.

Game objective - The object of this game is to build a deck, called a Life Deck. This deck represents a player’s spiritual maturity. Each player starts off with spiritual fruit, and a lot of sin. As the game progresses, players try to remove sin from their life decks and gain various cards, including more spiritual fruit. Character cards that represent people in need and sets of fruit cards are worth victory points. Sin cards are worth negative victory points. The player, with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

Game play - As a player you have the choice to pray or to shine.

If you choose to pray, you start off by using one of your spiritual gifts. Spiritual gifts allow a player to gain a specific spiritual fruit card. There are 9 different kinds of fruit cards and they are the resource used in Shine to gain other cards.
- You may use the abilities on scripture cards that take effect during prayer.
- You may remove a card from your deck, usually sin.
- You may also place any number of cards from your hand into your discard pile.
- To conclude your turn you draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

If you choose to shine, you start by using one of your spiritual gifts.
- You may play and use the abilities on scripture cards and character cards that you gained during previous rounds.
- You may trade a fruit card with any card in the fellowship pool. The fellowship pool allows players to trade fruit cards.
- You may trade in 2 fruit cards to gain a new fruit card. When you trade in a card it is removed from your deck.
- You may play fruit cards to gain new scripture and character cards.
- To conclude your turn draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

When a player draws the last card from their life deck, the current round ends.
- Each player shuffles their discarded life cards and places them under their life decks.
- Then each player draws the top card of their temptation deck and does what it says. Temptation cards force the player to draw more sin cards and have stronger effects if a player has sin that they have not dealt with.

The game ends when all of the temptation cards have been drawn. Character cards and full sets of 9 fruit cards are worth positive victory points and sin cards are worth negative victory points. The player with the most victory points is considered to be the most spiritually mature and is declared the winner.

151470.name: The Phantom Train
151470.description:
designer summary

This quick start Castles & Crusades adventure is a fun one shot or convention piece.

Made with that idea in mind, it is a fast set up and linear (you are on a train).

With new creatures, traps this timed adventure lets you live in the moment, or if played poorly, forever as one of the train's inhabitants.

An adventure for 4 player characters of 3rd level of play (can be adjusted accordingly).

Also includes the following: 3 New Creatures, New Spells.

151471.name: Conservation of Ninjutsu
151471.description:
From the Introduction:

Capable of defeating hordes of enemies on his own, a lone ninja—when given sufficient reason—can bring an evil emperor’s dynasty to its knees. Unfortunately, you’re not that lone ninja. Your evil empire is about to fall apart. You’ll be up against overwhelming odds: your entire ninja army versus a single hero. Are you up to the challenge?

Conservation of Ninjutsu is a single-player role-playing game in which you, the evil emperor, must rally his ninja army to defeat a lone hero who threatens your way of life. The hero fights for good, justice, and fair taxes. Will you let him ruin your dynasty, or will your ninja hordes be strong enough to stop him?

151472.name: Dungeons and Draperies
151472.description:
Author Summary'

Goblins!

A nest of goblins has sprung up in the hills near the baron's manor house. The local peasants complain of missing chickens, polluted streams, ungodly stench, and humanoid hooligans who won't get off their lawn. Something must be done!

The call has gone out from the baron. Any of his household servants who help to rid the land of this nuisance will receive a Saturday off—with pay! But his patience is limited. Near sundown he will visit the goblin den personally, and if he doesn't like what he sees his soldiers will drive the goblins away. Will you heed the call to adventure? Will you succeed in remodeling the goblin den? Will the baron reward you with Sunday off, so you can sleep in?

Dungeons & Draperies is a light-hearted fantasy makeover game for three or more players. The baron's servants know how to run a household—but can they teach an unruly goblin tribe to be good neighbors? They have only twelve hours to make the goblin den sanitary and presentable, prepare a reception for the baron, make an assortment of appetizing hors d'oeuvres containing absolutely no rat meat, and teach the goblins basic court manners. If they succeed, the baron will reward them; if they fail, they earn the baron's wrath, and the goblin tribe will be evicted!

151473.name: Risen 3: Titan Lords
videogameexpansion: Risen 3: Titan Lords – Uprising of the Little Guys
videogamehonor: 2014 Gamescom Best Role Playing Game of the Year Winner
151473.description:
User Summary

A young warrior is attacked from the shadows and deprived of his soul. He sets off to reclaim what is lost amidst the darkness that is spreading throughout the world. The banned Mages could be powerful allies on his quest. To get their help, he needs to find the Mage sanctuary on Taranis, also known as the Island of Thunder. Protected by the Guardians, the Mages search the mines of Taranis for crystals loaded with magic energy.

151474.name: Shoebox
151474.description:
Author's summary:

There it sits at the top of the closet, collecting dust, only remembered briefly during moves or when looking for winter coats. The shoebox. It’s old and worn, and has that cheap cardboard smell that was never meant to withstand the test of time. Still, for all of its flimsy mix of glue and tree pulp, it has since become a vault for old memories not often revisited. Pieces of the past you don’t look at, but don’t discard either. Contained within, amid photographs and old spoons and movie ticket stubs, is a lifetime made tangible. The story of your relationship.

It’s time to open up the shoebox and relive the past.

Shoebox is a role-playing game for two players, who together tell the story of a relationship from beginning to end through a box of keepsakes collected over that relationship. It may be joyous or tragic. It may be a whirlwind romance, a summer fling, or a love for the ages. But it is a love, or was at some point, and the course of love never did run smooth.

151475.name: Risen 2: Dark Waters – The Air Temple
151475.description:
User Summary

Gargoyles have infested the world and the mysterious Air Temple holds the answer as you explore and discover an additional island with new characters, quests, and enemies.

151477.name: Fröhliches Pilzesuchen
151477.description:
Object
Catch the most edible species of fungus on your trip through field & forest.

Game Play
Each player rolls the die and moves forward; ending on a marked space you make pick an edible fungus - if not already caught by another one.

If you have to pick an unedible one you lose one turn. Game ends after last edible fungus has been picked.

151478.name: Skull Cove
151478.description:
From publisher blurb:

DramaScape makes maps and miniatures for use with any game system with a focus on fantasy, horror, modern, and science fiction settings. Skull Cove is our second Savage Worlds product following our SciFi Weapon Cards available in PDF and print on demand on DriveThruCards. The map featured herein is a no overlay map.

“This island be friend to pirates and be enemy to privateers. Which be you strangers?”—Lirek Liriano [He reaches for his flintlock’s handle and pauses for a response…]

Skull Cove is a generic pirate town for use in any Savage Worlds pirate setting. There are descriptions of important locations and Skull Cove NPCs descriptions with Savage Worlds stat blocks. Several Savage Tales are included to get the players involved with the many personalities in the town. Skull Cove includes a 12 page full exterior map of the pirate town Skull Cove and its surrounding island environs and a 360-degree panoramic view of the town. Even if not using Savage Worlds, the map, places, personalities, and adventure hooks can be used in any pirate and blackpowder fantasy setting.

151479.name: Beyond the Serpentine Lock
151479.description:
From publisher blurb:

In ages past, a tiefling witch sequestered herself within a trap-laden tomb in order to acquire immortality for herself and her daughter. The witch must have failed, for her tomb has been sealed behind a serpent-shaped lock since that day. A clever hero found a way into the tomb centuries ago, but she was never seen again. Now, a key to the tomb has fallen into the hands of her descendant, who commissions the PCs to breach the ancient tomb and recover the hero’s remains. But this is no mere dungeon crawl; the PCs must overcome devious traps, intricate puzzles, a village of wary lizardfolk, and ancient betrayals to unearth a lost legacy.

"Beyond the Serpentine Lock" is a wilderness and dungeon adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game suitable for any campaign world. Presented for PCs of 3rd or 4th level, this adventure also includes notes and statistics for scaling challenges to PCs of lower or higher level. The adventure contains several player handouts and a file containing 1 inch scale color maps of the encounter areas ready for printing.

151480.name: Kingdom of Toads
151480.description:
From publisher blurb:

The curse will echo in legends: in one dire moment, each man, woman, and child in the Kingdom of Kelwyk was transformed into a simple toad. Only the king's advisor, displaced from his body on an astral sojourn at the time of the curse, retains enough of his mind to summon aid. Could the rival County of Stonevale be behind this affliction? Or has Kelwyk's decades-old foe, the vile witch Vakelna, wrought her vengeance at last? The world's greatest champions are urgently needed to unravel the mystery of the Kingdom of Toads.

"Kingdom of Toads" is an adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game of legendary scope and suitable for any campaign world. Presented for PCs of 17th or 18th level, and specifically designed to accommodate the varied and spectacular powers of high-level PCs, this adventure also includes notes and statistics for scaling challenges to PCs of lower or higher level.

151481.name: Teeth of the Storm
151481.description:
From publisher blurb:

Late at night, the storm howls and sheets of rain fall. The High Road is supposed to be safe and well-traveled, but this stormy night there has been no one else on the road and no place to stop for shelter. A gruesome scene on a rain-slicked bridge leads to a nighttime race to grant a restless soul peace.

Teeth of the Storm is a gothic horror adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that can be set along any isolated trade road. Presented for PCs of 1st level, this 38-page adventure also includes notes and statistics for scaling challenges to PCs of higher level, pregenerated PCs, and a file containing 1 inch scale color maps of the encounter areas ready for printing.

Teeth of the Storm also contains notes to run this adventure in the "ultra-horror" style of horror movies, where the body count is sure to rise and only the smart and lucky will survive until sunrise.

151482.name: The Six Griffons Haunt
151482.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Six Griffons Lodge, an exclusive club for gentlemen-warriors, is experiencing strange noises and curious apparitions. The manor's small staff is at wits' end chasing phantoms. Tomorrow at noon, the lodge is hosting an elegant luncheon, and the hauntings must be stopped before that exclusive event-or before someone gets seriously hurt.

"The Six Griffons Haunt" is an investigative adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that can be set in any large city. Presented for PCs of 3rd or 4th level, this 32-page adventure also includes notes and statistics for scaling challenges to PCs of higher or lower level. The adventure contains a new monster, several player handouts, and a file containing a full-scale color map of the lodge ready for printing.

151483.name: The Underdelve Menace
151483.description:
From publisher blurb:

The remote village of Yonderdell has harbored dozens of adventuring parties over the years, each passing through on their way the nearby entrance to the Underdelve--the endless complex of lightless subterranean passages. Now Yonderdell is plagued by a ruthless nocturnal stalker. Several of the townspeople have disappeared; one was found horribly murdered. Locals suspect a creature from the Underdelve, but the guards posted at the entrance have seen no sign of creatures from the night below emerging onto the surface. This simple village needs brave heroes to unravel the clues and stop the terror before more lives are lost.

"The Underdelve Menace" is an investigative adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that can be set in any remote forested hills. Presented for PCs of 7th or 8th level, this adventure also includes notes and statistics for scaling challenges to PCs of higher or lower level. The adventure contains several player handouts and a file containing 1 inch scale color maps of the encounter areas ready for printing.

151484.name: The Emergency Character Collection
151484.description:
From publisher blurb:

For GMs in need! When you need a PC right now, “The Emergency Character Collection” comes to your rescue—whether you had a PC perish mid-adventure, a friend drop in for your game, or just want a stable of fully-statted NPCs.

“The Emergency Character Collection” includes thirteen detailed characters, each ready to play with printable character sheets for levels 1, 3, 6, and 9. Each complete PC comes with an illustration, roleplaying hooks, design notes, quick customization tips for different campaign types, interesting variants, and an in-game justification for appearing right on scene, right when you need it.

“The Emergency Character Collection” contains a daring half-elf bard, a jolly dwarf cleric, a roc-riding halfling druid, a bow-wielding elf fighter, a boisterous dwarf gunslinger, a surly tiefling magus, an honorable half-orc monk under a vow of poverty, a zealous human oracle of battle, an inquisitive catfolk paladin, a shrewd human urban ranger, an impetuous halfling rogue, a gregarious gnome sorcerer, and a fey-haunted elf witch. With character sheets for each of four different levels, you have 52 ready-to-go PCs. Just print and play!

151485.name: Bows & Ammo
151485.description:
From publisher blurb:

Characters in rpgs often have abilities are not tied to their class, race or skill, although they may be related/useful to it. These are called Feats.

They may be combat related, a way to tweak spells or even to do with the crafting of an item. Some will be useful to almost everyone, others only in very certain circumstances.

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about bows, crossbows and their ammo.

7 feats featured -

Called Shot Mastery - Be better at called shots
Customised Ammo - Ammo desigfned for one weapon
Lucky Ammo - Think your ammo is lucky? It probably is
Makeshift Melee Weapon - Use your bow as a weapon when out of ammo
Reactive Shooting - Shooting when surprised
Stand Your Ground - Those who charge you may be surprised
Warning Shot - Just to get their attention

151486.name: Tome of Tomes
151486.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is the book of all books!

We've released a LOT of classes in the past and we wanted to offer some support for those existing classes. We will be reprinting/updating some of the classes as well (free ones) but we will be shifting those updates to their respective PDFs in the near future .

While there is some variance, each class has some form of support (feats, items, etc), new archetypes, favored class bonuses for all core races (as well as some other races and LRGG races), and a short player's guide section on how to build/play the class.

Classes Included:

Bokor
Brave
Invoker
Martialist
Noble
Primal Host
Runesmith
Skirmisher
Wrestler
Yamabushi

151487.name: Darwin's Children: The Ravinoti
151487.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the fifth issue of Going Postal, a series of supplements for the Mutant Future role-playing game by Goblinoid Games.

This issue covers a new race called the Ravinoti. These bipedal man sized ravens are the ninjas of the post-apocalyptic world. Living in small family enclaves ruled by an elder, these creatures hire themselves out as spies, assassins, and couriers to anyone that can afford their fees.

This supplement includes both the monster stat block as well as the player character description including new mutations and an example Ravinoti lair, all for only 99 cents. The PDF has been set up with individual layers for page backgrounds which can be turned off for ease of printing.

151488.name: The Ethermancer: An "Eldritch" Reboot
151488.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Warlock for the Pathfinder generation!

It can be rather unsettling to learn that our infinite universe is but one of many, a miniscule dot on the roadmap of creation. These universes follow vastly different laws of physics and are prone to annihilating each other if they should ever touch. Though these events do happen, they are quite rare thanks to a weightless and almost completely elastic extrauniversal fluid known as the ether.

There are some puny and insignificant organic creatures who find themselves attuned to this background noise of the multiverse, this infinite source of energy that surrounds them and suffuses the void beyond the edge of everything. Finding they have the ability to communicate with the extrauniversal fluid and to draw from its raw, shapeless energy to do as they will, these ethermancers tend to fall into two camps. Some believe that the universe chose them to carry its greatest gift and use it to protect this tiny speck of creation. Others feel it is a perfect excuse to lord it over everyone. Given humanoid nature, the latter tends to be far more common.

The end result of three months of development, the ethermancer base class takes equal parts Douglas Adams and H. P. Lovecraft to produce an “all day long” spellcaster class with a cosmic flavor. The spiritual successor to the warlock base class of the 3.5 days, the ethermancer seeks to have improved playability by offering the ability to mix and match spell effects to make custom evocations on the fly. Whereas the warlock simply blasted, the ethermancer can ask, “How hard?” Thanks to the advent of a spell point pool, players must choose whether or not to spend more than they will regenerate next turn. Incredibly potent effects are indeed possible, but firing them off without a care in the world will reduce the player to single-target ranged touch attacks in a hurry!

Roleplayers will be pleased to find that their character's personality and character development feeds directly back into the base class. Through the Multiuniversal Philosophy class feature, players decide how their character views their great gift and receives corresponding abilities that feed directly into the character's capstone. Further, the Aberrant Form and Aberrant Physiology class features highlight how the ethermancer's craft slowly twists his body. Is it worth it?

Product Features:

Favored Class options for all common races, as well as most featured races
Innovative spell point system allows for a spellcaster balanced like a martial class with the ability to “burst” like a classic spellcaster
Rules for detecting ethermagic, countering ethermagic, and qualifying for classic arcane spellcaster prestige classes as an ethermancer
140 spells, or “manifestations”, in five schools, or “etherhearts”
lesser blast – low cost, moderate damage evocation
greater blast – high cost, high damage evocation
alteration – defensive spells for self only
bestow – defensive and offensive spells for anyone but the caster
genesis – permanent creation of objects from pure energy

13 feats
Limited internal linking and bookmarking

151489.description:
Goal: Be the first to race to position '50' (basis station)
Game Play:
Typical 'roll & move' game - Roll the die by turns and step forward - ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Notes:
Contains pewter pawns
151489.name: Wintersport-Spiel

151490.name: Fat Zombie
151490.description:
The Zombies have come! Eat your fill of brains to become the fattest zombie. Only then will they call you King!

Fat Zombie is a funny little dice game, a game that melded two of our favorite pastimes: rolling dice and eating. Combined, they form an easy, fun-to-play game about trying to eat as many people as possible to become the fattest zombie! For once you become the fattest zombie... then you shall be King! Why King? Zombies don't care about money, political power or fundraising; they only care about brains. Not even the quality of brain eaten, merely the quantity.

So you and your friends (2-4) set out upon the grandest adventure: to eat as many brains as possible from the hapless humans! But be wary, for the humans are not without the means to defend themselves, and the fattest zombie may soon become the dead undead!

Playing Fat Zombie only takes about twenty minutes, even if you have never played the game. You and your friends are Zombies that wander the streets, looking for delicious brains! On your turn, you draw the top card of the deck and play it for all to see. You will then roll the die to see if you eat the human, if he escapes or hides, or if he kills you.

151491.name: Wolf Chess
151491.description:
As in standard chess, White moves first in Wolf Chess and the winning objective is checkmate, but the game is played on a 10x8 game board that contains a number of special pieces. The king, queen, rook, bishops, and pawns move and capture the same as they do in chess. Special pieces and changes to normal chess rules are as follows:


The wolf moves and captures as a chess rook or a chess knight.
The fox moves and captures as a chess bishop or a chess knight.
The nightrider moves and captures as a chess knight extended to make any number of steps in the same direction and in a straight line.
The sergeant moves and captures one step straight or diagonally forward. A sergeant can move, like a chess pawn, a double-step straight forward on its first move.
A pawn (but not a sergeant) may capture an enemy pawn or sergeant en passant.
Pawns and sergeants promote on the last rank to queen, wolf, fox, rook, bishop, nightrider, or knight. Pawns (but not sergeants) have an additional option of promoting to an elephant; the elephant piece, not present in the starting setup, moves and captures as a chess queen or a nightrider.
Wolf Chess has no castling.

151492.name: What Are You!?
151492.description:
THE STORY:
You've awakened in an abandoned building with no idea of who you are. There are others with you, also missing their memory. Writings on the wall by those left here before you say that there is no way out, except by being the last. It also says no one here is entirely human, that your true natures will soon begin to reveal themselves. You're not sure about this whole "not human" thing. All you do know is that you plan on being the last one standing, whatever you are!

THE GAME:
What Are You!? is a combat and deduction game where players secretly assume the role of one of ten different monsters. They will then use cards and power up tokens to attack each other while also attempting to uncover their opponents' true natures, and thus their ultimate weaknesses. The player that can outlast the others wins the game and becomes King (or Queen) of all monsters.

151493.description:
When mankind first discovered warp points, the gravitational anomalies that allowed him to travel to the stars, humanity spread like wildfire. A mighty Empire of Man grew in all directions. Colonies were planted on any planet that could support them. New spacefaring races were encountered, trade established, wars fought. Until finally the Empire of Man grew too large; internal dissention and external jealousy conspired to destroy it. First the far-flung Empire became too difficult to control centrally. Outer systems demanded more sovereignty, leading to rebellion and civil war. And once that war was lost, neighboring races pounced, snatching what they could. The collapse culminated in the bombardment of Terra and the subjugation of most of the remaining colonies.

Now, years later, humans on Old Terra have finally recovered. Humanity has spread all over known space, but humans on Mother Terra are ready to reach again for the stars. Ready to reclaim their Shattered Empire

Shattered Empire is a Print and Play (PnP) solo game in which the player takes on the struggles of the people of Earth to rebuild and defend their new star empire. The map depicts the systems around Old Terra and, beyond that, the regions controlled by other governments and races. Each turn represents about a decade of time and each ship counter is an individual starship. Players try to expand and defend their empire and score victory points over a 150 year period of time (less if your empire completely succumbs to its foes).
151493.name: Shattered Empire

151494.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 53 - Mar 2004)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
151494.description:
user summary

151496.name: Ordensbuch: Urieliten
151496.description:
from the backcover

Iberia, blühendes Eiland im Westen Europas. Kein Orden hat es je geschafft, eine Symbiose zwischen den Dogmen der Angelitischen Kirche und primitivem Volksglauben so perfekt umzusetzenwie die Diener Uriels. Dampfende Dschungel, zerklüftete Felsbarrieren und eine eigenbrötlerische Bevölkerung haben Iberia bislang vor allzu eifrigen Reformern und Feinden bewahrt, doch nun scheint die jahrelange Abgeschiedenheit ihren Tribut zu fordern. Folgen Sie uns. Werden Sie Teil dieser Geschichte. Erfahren Sie alles von den Bewahrern der Wege, von ihrem angelitischen Sonderweg bis hin zu internen Machtstrukturen. Lernen Sie geheime Waffen und mystische Artefakte kennen ...
Und werden Sie selbst zum Engel.

Google translation
Iberia, thriving island in the west of Europe. No Order has ever managed a symbiosis between the dogmas of the Church Angeli tables and primitive folk beliefs so perfect umzusetzenwie the servant of Uriel. Steaming jungles, jagged rock barriers and a self-reliant people have been saved from Iberia overzealous reformers and enemies, but now the years of seclusion seems to take their toll. Follow us. Become part of this story. Learn all of the keepers of the ways of her angeli matic exceptionalism to internal power structures. Learn about secret weapons and mystical artifacts ...
And you are even the angels.
